story:
Norm Breyfogle is an award winning comic book artist who needs your help.

The Whisper Campaign is here to help Norm Breyfogle recover from his stroke, and we need your help to do it.  By helping this campaign, you get a trade paperback featuring Norm's never-before-reprinted Whisper stories along with many additional comic stories from Norm Breyfogle and his award winning supporters in the comics industry!

On December 17, artist Norm Breyfogle was hospitalized due to a stroke. For many Batman fans, Norm Breyfogle stands out as one of the top artists from the late 20th Century as the penciller for Detective Comics from 1987 until 1993, as well as working on the Batman series from 1990 to 1992. Norm Breyfogle has most recently been seen illustrating Trinity of Sin: The Phantom Stranger and Batman Beyond, and the award-nominated Life With Archie.

Norm Breyfogle has suffered paralysis on his left side, and he draws with his left hand. He now needs months of extended care with daily therapy that will hopefully enable him to once again continue his skillful art and regain his mobility to be able to walk, draw and hopefully work again.

Like many comic book artists before him, Norm Breyfogle is experiencing the brutal reality where freelance artists with marginal or no insurance can find themselves crushed under hundreds of thousands of dollars of medical bills from career-altering illness or injury. Even in the Affordable Care Act era, health-care security eludes many artists, including ones with histories as extensive and reputable as Norm Breyfogle. He needs help. You can help save him and get cool art for doing so.

 Whisper- A 280-page trade paperback containing Whisper #3-11 
Written and created by Steven Grant (Punisher, 2Guns) and published by First Comics in 1986. The series has never been reprinted before, this will become a collectors dream and a great chance to see Norm Breyfogle early work. Steven has given us permission to reprint Norm Breyfogle issues of Whisper to raise funds for his recuperation.

$5 you get a Thank you & digital wallpaper
 you get your name will be added as a contributor to the book, and you'll receive a digital wallpaper of art from the book.
$10 you get the PDF of  Whisper
A trade paperback containing Whisper #3-11, the book will also have Norm Breyfogle rare Bar story, and lots of other surprises and stretch goals!
$50 you get the print trade paperback Whisper
Book & PDF For the first time in over 20 years you will get in print the trade paperback containing Whisper #3-11,The book will also have Norm Breyfogle rare  Bar story, and lots of other surprises and stretch goals! Plus a thank you in the book!
$75 you get a rare Cary Polkovitz signed print
A print of Alan Grant and Cary Polkovitz's story for the book, signed and numbered by artist Cary Polkovitz! Limited to 100 pieces.
$100 you get The Whisper Campaign hardcover
A hardcover edition of the book , this is the first time and only time you can get this in hardcover, limited to only 250 copies.
$500 you get Lee Marrs original art
Amazing artist Lee Marrs has graciously donated her original art for her story to benefit Norm. Three pages, each one of a kind.

But that's not all! We're also including stories and art from all sorts of people that we're adding to the project as stretch goals and additional incentives, including:

  • Norm Breyfogle never before printed Munden's Bar story, written by Valerie D'Orazio (Punisher) and Martha Thomases (Dakota North).
  • An all-new story by Alan Grant (Detective Comics) and Cary Polkovitz (Ukiyo). Unlocked at $11,000!
  • An all new story by Martha Thomases and Richard Case (Doom Patrol). Unlocked at $12,000!
  • An all-new story by Robert Greenberger (Star Trek) and Tom Lyle (Starman).  Unlocked at $13,000!
  • An all new story by Mike Friedrich (Star*Reach) and Lee Marrs (Pudge Girl Blimp). Unlocked at $14,000!
  • An all-new GrimJack story by John Ostrander (Suicide Squad), Timothy Truman (Conan), John Workman, and Lovern Kindzierski. Unlocked at $15000!
  • An all new story by Mike Baron (Nexus) and Neil Handson. Unlocked at $17,500!
  • An all new story by Danny Fingeroth (Darkhawk) and Bob Hall (The Avengers). Unlocked at $20,000!

We're talking about at least a 280-page book. How big will it be? Well, that depends on you… and how much money we raise for Norm Breyfogle.

If you're a comic creator who'd like to help contribute to this anthology, email greenbergerbob@gmail.com and tell us what you'd like to do. We're looking for pinups, stories, testimonials, etc. pieces that we can use both for the book, and as perks here.

Spread the word about The Whisper Campaign through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and so on. The more people we reach, the more we can help.
story_txt:
Norm Breyfogle is an award winning comic book artist who needs your help.The Whisper Campaign is here to help Norm Breyfogle recover from his stroke, and we need your help to do it.  By helping this campaign, you get a trade paperback
featuring Norm's never-before-reprinted Whisper
stories along with many additional comic stories from  Norm Breyfogle and his award winning supporters
in the comics industry!On December 17, artist Norm Breyfogle was hospitalized due to a stroke. For many Batman fans, Norm Breyfogle
stands out as one of the top artists from the late 20th Century as the
penciller for Detective Comics from 1987 until 1993, as well as working
on the Batman series from 1990 to 1992.  Norm Breyfogle has most recently been
seen illustrating Trinity
of Sin: The Phantom Stranger and Batman Beyond, and the award-nominated Life With
Archie. Norm Breyfogle
 has suffered paralysis on his left
side, and he draws with his left hand. He now needs
months of extended care with daily therapy that will hopefully enable him to
once again continue his skillful art and regain his mobility to be able to walk, draw and hopefully work again.

Like many comic book artists before
him,  Norm Breyfogle is experiencing the brutal reality where freelance artists with marginal or no insurance can find themselves
crushed under hundreds of thousands of dollars of medical bills from career-altering illness or injury. Even in the
Affordable Care Act era, health-care security eludes many artists, including
ones with histories as extensive and reputable as  Norm Breyfogle. He needs help. You can help save him and get cool art for doing so.

story:
USPTO approved My Trade Mark! Sexy Astrology II

I am continuing to raise money to defend my trademark Sexy Astrology, which was approved by the USPTO, last June 6th, 2014.  I am in the throws of a small legal battle after being approved by the United States Patent and Trademark Office.  A woman with a dissimilar mark has being suing me, to stop the use of Sexy Astrology—the name of my YouTube astrology show.  She also sent me a cease and desist letter.  We are nearing the end of the argument, and god willing she will settle.  Namely I will most likely write a statement saying:  “I will not ever use my trade mark SEXY ASTROLOGY to do compatibility readings or matchmaking between couples. And that SEXY ASTROLOGY is a straight astrology show for entertainment purposes only.”  It’s really a show about the astrological weather.

Last July when I began my first indiegogo campaign I successfully raised about 1700.00$ in just 6 days. I was moving to Ithaca for the year and was so happy for the turnout!  Thank you for your continued support.

I have been practicing doing monthly horoscopes for 7 years through my youtube comedy channel called SEXY ASTROLOGY.  No, I do not think I am sexy, but in the world of astrology the two words are easy to remember. And being that the show is grounded in comedy, my then husband and I came up with the idea after I had my 3rd child and the result was a small smash!  I have over 2 million video views and being that astrology is a topic which many take way too seriously—or  people just don't believe in it at all—I  thought how can I sell my advice better?  Make it SEXY, but the bottom line is keeping it simple only offer one or two simple ideas & keep it funny so people keep coming back!  I love helping people build self esteem & trust in themselves all while having a good laugh.  It's a self-help show, with a bent on comedy and art...Astrology is one of those topics, that needs to be televised...

The reason I am interested in keeping my Trade Mark is that in the last yearsomeone else started using the term "Sexy Astrology" with their column.I thought, "oh no... guess I'll apply for a trade mark.”  The United State Patent andTrademark Office approved it as of June 6, 2014.  I am so excited! However I did not expect someone to file a notice of Opposition, and Cease and Desist letter, turning this into a federal case.  With a little more support (2000.00$) I can successfully defend my mark, my lawyer is doing an excellent job so far.  I have a strong case and over the years, 400 pages of notes, from my monthly readings and a VERY different product from the person who is trying to take it down.  Intellectual property is important to all of us!  If I am able to secure my trademark I will be able to continue to use the name Sexy Astrology for my show, with out worrying if someone else will be capitalizing on my hard work.  And who knows? Possibly obtain a slot on CNN, for a season or two, Ok Cable Access, maybe the History Channel? O?  Bio?  As well I will be coming out with the Sexy Astrology T shirt and if all goes well there will be the coffee cup and tote!

So far I have spent about 5000.00$ obtaining and preparing arguments to defend my mark. All of the funds are going to my Trade Mark attorney in Los Angeles.  Regardless of contributions I will still be providing Astrology (&sometimes SEXY) Videos.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this, and thank you for your continued love and support.

Don't worry of course If you can't contribute keep coming back and I will see you on the Movie Screen.  Please Share this with your friends if you are able!

story:
WE KINDLY ASK YOU TO PLEASE BE AWARE OF WHAT YOU'RE CONTRIBUTING TO! READING IS FUNDAMENTAL!

WHO: Abendigo Douglas is an art veteran of 18-years, who dabbles in the work of logo making, tattoo art, animation and graphic designing. 23 Years young, Abendigo, better known as Ben or Lightning Wolf, has started his own art designing business with a team of talented and diverse young artists who provide services for logos, tattoos and more called Lone wolf Art Productions. Douglas first started out in the art world being fascinated with Anime. He modeled his artwork after anime's such as Yugioh, Yu Yu Hakusho, Shamon King, Pokemon, Digimon and etc. Douglas now expands his artwork to realistic and some abstract. Douglas is currently accepting all inquiries and is now making "how to draw" YouTube videos for his fans.

The current indiegogo project he is trying to launch is to buy a digital manga drawing tablet for editing and printing for his long awaited Vol. 1 of his comic book series "Spirit". Ben has been working on Spirit for at east 6 years now with the help of his fellow artists/friends. His love and compassion for Japanese art has influenced him since he was a young boy and he only wants to give back to Japanese culture as well as his friends by finally printing his manga. The finishing touches are almost done and with your help he can digitally produce the comic and have it printed. 

What the book is about?

Spirit is about two girls who believed that they were just every day college women but in manga reality, their world eventually turns upside down. The world of Spirit is filled with magic, romance, laughter, mind-blowing action packed fights and ever lasting friendships. We wish we can say more but you guys will just have to wait until the book is released. Or Donate $50 and get an inclusive preview of some pages from the book!

What We Need & What You Get

  • A digital editing manga hand-drawing table which ranges in $800-$1,000 (this will make the comic sequences come out finer and will speed up the process of editing and printing).
  • The remainder of the money will go towards printing the books which prices around $999-1,000
  • If we do not reach the entirety of the goal we will come out of our own pockets to fund the difference.
  • YOU WILL GET LOTS OF REWARDS OUT OF THIS SO DON'T THINK THAT WE WILL NOT GIVE BACK OR CARE ABOUT YOU. All your help is needed and wanted and we'd appreciate it a lot!

The Impact

 The difference their contribution will make:

  • Gives back to the anime culture
  • Teaches you about Japanese culture
  • Teaches others that anything is possible if you believe and have loved ones behind you
  • A lot of people have been waiting for this for so long!
  • Entertainment to comic book lovers

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean YOU can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about MY campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!


STICKER^^^^^

story:
Short Summary

               November 12th 1966 five men digging a grave at a cemetery near Clendenin, West Virginia witnessed the first appearance of the legendary creature we have come to call The MothMan. The man like beast took flight gliding over the diggers heads.

                These mysterious encounters continued to haunt the towns people of Point Pleasant all the way until December 15th 1967 when the Silver Bridge collapsed. Seventy-five vehicles plunged into the Ohio River killing forty-six people. Some believe the MothMan was sent to warn us of the tragedy to come, some believe the MothMan was a government experiment set loose and the Men in Black used the bridge as an act to distract the towns folk as they hunted down their lost science abomination.

                Either way, things have gone quiet in Point Pleasant. That is until now. When the MothMan has made its return. But something is different this time around…something is wrong…so terribly wrong!

               Join in the terror as King Toad Comics brings to you our very first 28 page comic! Introducing the first Cryptic Legends to our monster universe!

                                     Illustration by Ilia Sviatlovich

     

What We Need & What You Get

Help us reach our $3,000 goal to help get this book printed and shipped to your door and to help bring to you even more goodies along the way!

Every backer will receive a Carla Tornielli print! And a Joe Ball Halloween special print!

 

Carla Tornielli Print!

 

Joe Ball Halloween Print!

 

Cover art by Preston Asevedo

 

 

Cover B: Pat Maxton

 

Stretch Goals

+4000 Unlocks Trading Card by Simon Pothier! Creator and artist that brought you Blood Hunt and now the Nat Verse!

+5000 Unlocks Trading Card by Matt Burke! Creator and artist that brought you Butch Cleaver!

 

 

The Team

Shane Mess: writer

Ilia Sviatlovich: interior  illustrator 

Jeff Y: Colorist 

Adam AF: Letterer 

Joe Ball: Halloween print 

Preston Asevedo: Cover artist A

Doodle Bags: Cover artist B

Carla Tornielli: Print artist 

Sean Sweens:  decal and logo

Risks & Challenges

Where we are! The first 12 pages are already penciled, inked, colored and yes even lettered! Ilia also has finished the penciling of the next 12 pages and has started inking! This project is well on its way to a complete book to be held in readers hands!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not afford Cryptic Legends: The MothMan at this time, we completely understand. There are other ways you can help. Simply share campaign on your social media and tell your friends we are here!

story:
Love is a battlefield...

and it's Valentine's Day in Tokyo!!! 

Promo image by Matthew Weldon with colors by Candice Han

 

It's Power Rangers meets Jem and the Holograms shoved head first into a 1960s psychedelic rock kaleidoscope!

Indiegogo Exclusive Cover by

Alejandro Mirabal!

 

Featuring Pencils & Inks by Matthew Weldon

COLORED PAGES BY NESTOR REDULLA JR

 

 

 

Level of completion:

UPDATE JUNE 4, 2020

Comic printing is complete! We will have them in our hands soon for shipping!!  Also, the hardcover Gallery Editions are scheduled to arrive today! As soon as we receive those, we will send out the few to those who purchased just the Gallery Edition, plus the books to Matthew Weldon for the headsketch and autographed copies!  It's all coming together nicely and will be in everyone's hands soon!! Thank you for your support!

 

Pencils: 100%  Inks: 100%  Colors: 100%  Letters:  100%  Cover: 100%

This is the first 24-page issue of an ongoing series.

SEICHO 66 goes to the printer in March and will be bagged, boarded, and mailed directly to you in a Gemini mailer in April!  Printed in the USA  (The Alejandro Mirabal special cover will only be available in this first crowdfunded print run!)


Writer/Creator - Matthew Fowler (The Prospectres, Red Giant Battle S)
Pencils & Inks/Co-Creator - Matthew Weldon (Punchline, TMNT Jennika #1 cover)
Colors - Nestor Redulla Jr. (Punchline); w/ Candice Han (pgs 2-3)(Alien: The Original Screenplay new series cover, Bloodshot #6 cover)
Letters - Eric Weathers (Everything)

Cover Art- Alejandro Mirabal (Longharbor, Earthworm Jim cover)

Logo - Bob Stone (Jawbreakers logo, Ironsights logo)

story:
Inspired by classic horror comics from Vampirella to Werewolf by Night... Ailsa Dark: Werewolves & Bampots has old-school blood running through its veins but its DNA is thoroughly modern and more than a wee bit twisted!

Werewolves are killing their own kind and ghouls are devouring the remains!
The "Children of the Night" are staying in the shadows and keeping quiet... fearful of what's to come!

A mysterious antagonist is putting all the pieces into place for a deadly game that will culminate in the apocalyptic "Ceremony of the Wolf" and only Ailsa Dark can stop it!

Imagine a city and its people whose only hope for salvation lies within the darkness. This is Ailsa Dark's Glasgow... "no mean city"... and things are about to get biblical!

AILSA DARK: Werewolves & Bampots is a four issue series that tells the first story arc in the life of Ailsa Dark. These first two issues introduce Ailsa, her friends and enemies, the world they inhabit and set in motion the events that will lead to an explosive and bloody finale!

 

 

 

 

How a page of finished artwork is created by combining line art, colours, effects and copy.

Hi, I'm William Hazle, the creator of Ailsa Dark. I have been producing comics since 2015 in the UK, starting with my anthology title Tales of Mystery and Imagination and culminating in Ailsa Dark: Werewolves & Bampots. My professional background is in games development, and I now lecture in computer art when I'm not making comics.

Check out these snippets from the early reviews before diving into those Perks & Stretch Goals...

The art is a glorious blend of real-life cityscapes and B Movie gore that just happens to be caught in the middle of a cracking thriller… this is already an early contender for the 2019 highlights list.
The G-Man, COMICS ANONYMOUS


This is a really fun read. A Glaswegian version of Elvira (but, let’s face it a whole lot cooler)... She is also coincidentally the main weapon in a network combating the visitors from The Otherworld... It’s a book that you’ll enjoy reading and it will give you that little nipple tweak of nostalgia for old school horror comics like The House of Hammer magazine or even Vampirella.
Tony Ez Esmond (Prof. Riptide) NEVER IRON ANYTHING

And as for the artwork, its luscious luminescence belies the darkness and violence of the story. The images are thick with colour and bright with saturation and contrast. It’s especially striking during action beats, where blood and gore flare in crimson sprays.
STARBURST Magazine

The artwork is phenomenal!
The BREWGOODERS Podcast

2 ISSUES!  72 pages of old-school horror and adventure!

   Each issue is...

  •       36 pages, in a large A4 magazine sized format (A4: 8.3" x 11.7")
  •       32 interior pages, 130 gsm silk paper (No ads)
  •       170 gsm 4 page cover, with a smooth soft touch lamination

 

 

DARK DELUXE

AILSA DARK #1 (36 page signed comic).
AILSA DARK #2 (36 page signed comic).
HORROR HOSTESS Ltd Edition giclee art print - 8” x 10” (signed).
Digital copies of both comics.
+ All stretch goals when achieved!

The HORROR HOSTESS Limited Edition print:

AILSA DARK 1+2

AILSA DARK #1 (36 page signed comic).
AILSA DARK #2 (36 page signed comic).
Digital copies of both comics.
+ All stretch goals when achieved!

 

DARK DOUBLE

Why not grab 2 copies of both issues and treat a friend with a fear-filled gift!
2 x AILSA DARK #1 (36 page signed comic).
2 x AILSA DARK #2 (36 page signed comic).
Digital copies of both comics.
+ All stretch goals when achieved!

 

DIGITAL ONLY

Digital copies of both issues. If digital is your thing, then this is the perk for you. You'll also get a digital version of the stretch goal 1 mini-comic when achieved!

 

AILSA! ORIGINAL ARTWORK

AILSA DARK HORROR HOSTESS: This is the original fully pencilled artwork used for the giclee print (signed). See the second video at the top of the page... I'll be creating this artwork as the campaign progresses and you can watch me do it.
AILSA DARK #1 (36 page signed comic).
AILSA DARK #2 (36 page signed comic).
HORROR HOSTESS Ltd Edition giclee art print - 8” x 10” (signed).
Digital copies of both comics.
+ All stretch goals when achieved!

This is the final pencil art for the AILSA! ORIGINAL ARTWORK tier:

 

FIGHT! ORIGINAL ARTWORK

FIGHT! Original fully pencilled artwork (signed). Ailsa in a deadly battle with the evil Tattybogle Man!
AILSA DARK #1 (36 page signed comic).
AILSA DARK #2 (36 page signed comic).
HORROR HOSTESS Ltd Edition Giclee Art Print - 8” x 10” (signed).
Digital copies of both comics.
+ All stretch goals when achieved!

When AILSA DARK: Werewolves & Bampots reaches its initial target, I'll be able to start adding some cool stretch goals like these:

STRETCH GOAL 1: MINI-COMIC IN 3D!

This is a great stretch goal and everyone who buys physical copies of the comics gets it!

£2,000 Unlocks the Tattybogle Man mini-comic in 3D! This is a reprinting of my Tattybogle Man story from the out-of-print Tales of Mystery and Imagination #2. A blood drenched homage to Hammer Horror by way of The Wicker Man!

And in the best b-movie tradition it's being remastered in 3D! Glasses will be provided!

A5: 5.8" x 8.3"

Here's a 3D test... It shows the remastered artwork in Black & White and the initial 3D separations (before finalisation and polishing).


STRETCH GOAL 2: AILSA VS DRACULA ART PRINT

A stunning 8" x 10" full colour giclee art print on quality art stock.

£2,500 unlocks a signed Ailsa Dark vs Dracula gicglee print! This is a high quality 8" x 10" full colour giclee art print of original artwork that I'll create during the campaign if stretch goal 1 is achieved. You can follow me on social media and see how I create it!

 

STRETCH GOAL 3: MYSTERY COMIC?

£3,500 unlocks a complete 36 page Mystery Comic! 

Whatever could it be? One thing's for certain... it'll be a shocker!

UPDATE: How's this for a teaser?

Comics and prints will be packaged in rigid boxes (see below) and securely sealed with clear tape. I've calculated the costs for the P&P and have kept it as low as possible, while still offering the best possible service. Keep in mind that as the stretch goals get added to your perk, the P&P remains the same... that's what they call a bargain!

The remastered Issue 1 is in the bag and is ready to go to print!

Issue 2 has been written, the pencils have been  thumb-nailed, and it's now ready to be fully illustrated and coloured!

I've published comics and sold them successfully at UK comic cons for some years now. I've been hitting deadlines throughout my professional career and will make this one. Follow me on social media and you'll see all the updates and work in progress.

This is a passion project for me and I've got a whole new world to build and share with you... let's do this!

Help spread the word by sharing across social media!

Even if you can't contribute to the campaign, and I know how tight funds can be, you can still help by sharing and following me on social media. I hope that your interest has been piqued and that you'll give me and Ailsa Dark a chance to build and share this world.
story_txt:
Inspired by classic horror comics from Vampirella to Werewolf by Night... Ailsa Dark: Werewolves & Bampots has old-school blood running through its veins but its DNA is thoroughly modern and more than a wee bit twisted!
Werewolves are killing their own kind and ghouls are devouring the remains!The "Children of the Night" are staying in the shadows and keeping quiet... fearful of what's to come!
A mysterious antagonist is putting all the pieces into place for a deadly game that will culminate in the apocalyptic "Ceremony of the Wolf" and only Ailsa Dark can stop it!
Imagine a city and its people whose only hope for salvation lies within the darkness. This is Ailsa Dark's Glasgow... "no mean city"... and things are about to get biblical!

AILSA DARK: Werewolves & Bampots is a four issue series that tells the first story arc in the life of Ailsa Dark. These first two issues introduce Ailsa, her friends and enemies, the world they inhabit and set in motion the events that will lead to an explosive and bloody finale!

story:
"Crazed genius" - A.L. Kennedy

With a foreword by award-winning novelist and fellow Dundonian A.L. Kennedy, 'Striptease' is my latest collection of comic strips from Scotland's only pro-independence daily, The National.

Taking up where 'Greg Moodie's Election Dissection' left off, it charts the fall of Jim Murphy and the collapse of the Labour vote in Scotland; the plight of Alistair 'Fiery Pants' Carmichael; the rise of the Brexiteer buffoons who got their wish then shuffled off leaving the rest of us to deal with the consequences; and the ongoing saga of accidental leader Jeremy Corbyn presiding over a terminally divided Westminster opposition.

What I Need & What You Deadbeats Get In Return

The book will be printed in Scotland by Bell & Bain Ltd, who were previously responsible for 'Greg Moodie Versus The Union', 'Election Dissection', 'Welcome to Cairnstoon' and 'Borrowing Burns'. Funds of £7500 are needed to cover this cost, along with postage and sturdy packaging.

In return, you will receive a signed copy of 'Striptease', a 144-page full colour, A4 landscape book with a gloss laminated cover, matt coated art paper within and a cracking 1000-word foreword by A.L. Kennedy.

Additional perks include the hardback 'Borrowing Burns', my 'factually-dubious' account of the creation of the Tam O'Shanter Murals in Torphichen ("Hugely enjoyable" - Alan Bissett), and signed Moodie prints.

The Road To Independence

The independence debate is STILL notably lacking in humour, and only the grassroots Yes camp has ever been able to instill it with any sense of colour or fun. I'm proud to count myself part of that group and I firmly believe not only that independence is inevitable, but also that these modest little toons are in their own peculiar way charting Scotland's road there. If you're interested in a satirical account of the obstacles a small country faced in its ongoing fight for independence, you'll need 'Striptease'.

Slackers, Deviants & The Unstable

I know you mostly all fall into one of the categories above, but if you could take time off from your admittedly demanding loafing schedules and see your way to sharing this campaign as widely as possible, I might be able to continue with this cartooning business. Sláinte x.

story:
Welcome to this space port, visitor!

What is this about?

I would like to write and illustrate a 60 pages comic-book for children with this main characters: Matilda & Bouru.

Matilda is a martian girl. Another one of the millions that have come to earth following a dream of health and fame in the rich human planet. 

Bouru is a robot, a robot who was thrown away. He can feel, indeed, he can feel too much. When he gets scared he become a very crazy robot who has not control of himself and his surroundings. No one can control him, except Matilda. She is capable of calm Bouru's fears with her love and care.


In which stage is the project now?

At this very point I'm developing characters and scenarios. I've got a clue of what will happen but I need time to sit down and write. This will be a CHILDREN COMIC-BOOK, 60 pages in full color for children +8 age.

The project will be developed during the next months to be show in comic and children book fairs.


GOAL or NO GOAL

What will happen if I reach or not the goal:
  • If the GOAL is reached: I'll produce all the final pages of the full comic, trying at the same time to find a publisher. 
  • If the GOAL is NOT reached: I'll go to the publishers with prints of all the work that I could have done, with at least: A full synopsis of the story, 20-30 storyboard pages and 4-8 final pages.

Note that writing/drawing/coloring a full book is a work that requires lots of time. My compromise is to end it before a year once the campaign is finished.

What do I need the money for?

  • Buy time. I need time for all the writing, create the art and make all the designs look cool.
  • New Tools: I need to upgrade my graphic tablet. At the moment I'm using an office one, not drawing one. My choose is an Intuos 4 Medium or Large (depending on the total amount reached)
  • Digital prints, translations and plane tickets for the different fairs (Frankfurt, Angoulême, Bologna...)
  • Perks and shipments.
  • Pay the rent and freelance taxes in my country.


You are part of the process

The production of this project will be totally transparent (with mail updated to the donators) and in my personal blog samthings.com until it gets to the final stage. Perks have been through to be particular interesting, as long as the project get to his goal or not.


My actual situation

At the moment I've been working a year and a half in a graphic novel to be published in france at the end of this year by Delcourt. This long period of production has left me in a difficult economic situation. While I'm working through this 200 hundred pages book, I need to look ahead for new projects. I would love to spend my time with this one!

story:
Hello!  My name is George Jones and I am the lead producer of the Tyler Rose City Comic Con in Tyler, TX.  I have been working with a talented team of fun loving people to bring the best event we can to Tyler and we would like your help.  You see, we have already had a successful comic con and everyone who attended enjoyed it very much, but we want to make it bigger and better...in short, we want to blow the doors off Tyler, TX and start letting the world know we are here, we are cool, and we are going to be a name to remember!

What we are trying to achieve is the funding to bring big name stars (TV Stars, Movie Stars, Comic Book authors & artists, Game Designers, and so much more) to our event this October 25 & 26 at the Holiday Inn in Tyler.  Unfortunately, no one will come for free, and our current funding is very limited.  Some great folks like Sylvester McCoy (the 7th Doctor Who) and others have reached out to us showing interest in coming, but our budget just won't cover it.  With your help, we may be able to pull off some amazing things.  All funds received through this fund raiser will go toward getting these people here and making the entire event fun and entertaining for everyone who attends!  Wouldn't you like to meet one of the cast members from Star Trek?  Stargate?  Lost Girl?  Dr. Who?  or how about a comic book artist / author like the amazing Mike Grell?  What if we could bring in Stan Lee, Angelina Jolie, or even Vin Diesel?  The sky is the limit if we have the funds!  And you will be rewarded for every donation you give with one or more of our super cool perks!

As I mentioned before, we have already had a successful comic con last year and it brought in over 3,000 people which boosted the Tyler economy and helped that much more to put us on the map!  We are shooting for an attendance of 10,000 or more this year and that can mean some pretty exciting things for the Tyler area.  First of all, it will definitely help boost the economy with our attendees spending money on food, hotel stays, and more as the check out the area.  Secondly, it will introduce legions of people to the Tyler (and in some cases, Texas itself) area and perhaps make them want to come back to shop or vacation and spend more time here.  And finally, these famous folks that are coming in will speak to others...directors, producers, actors, etc who may want to come and do a project here.  What would it be like if a Hollywood film crew came and made a major motion picture in Tyler / East Texas?  Would you take a bit part as an extra in it?  Would you audition for a supporting role?  Would it create an awareness of how awesome this area is for other production companies?  Together, we can make it happen!

    Friends, I have the knowledge and the connections to make this happen.  Some of you may know the events we (Tours of Tyler) have done before such as the Autumn Festival at Parrott Park, Live Action Murder Mysteries, Tyler Writer's Conference, Vinyl Record Show, Tyler Paranormal Conference, Great Texas Pow Wow, etc.  and if you have, then you probably know they were lots of fun and all successful.  This event is already in motion and will happen, but the difference in the size and scope of it entirely depends on how much we raise here...as does the extended good will and possibilities after.  If we fail, it may never grow and eventually, it may end.  But if we succeed, we are creating a legacy that will not only increase our presence on the world wide grid, but will eventually lead to employment and staffing, thus creating new jobs and other future employment opportunities. 

      It's OK if you can't contribute monetarily.  We understand how tight things can be sometimes.  But if you can't make a contribution of even a dollar, then at least share this page and help us spread the word.  We thank you for anything and everything you do!

story:
Welcome everyone! We are Think Alike Productions, a writing team based out of Miami, Florida.
 
 
We came together one day and decided we wanted to create a book that kids and adults would both gravitate towards, something that could fill the void we felt was missing in the magical genre. This lead us to begin working on our flagship project, a comic book series titled International Agency of Magic. Over the last year, there have been many bumps in the road, but we've refused to give up until we made this idea a reality! We all poured our blood, sweat and tears into the I.A.M. project and we’re proud to say we were finally able to complete the first Issue of I.A.M., slated for release in July of 2013.
 
 

As we mentioned, Issue One is on it’s way, and to get it out there, we need your help! Funds from this campaign will go towards printing Issue One as well as production costs for Issues Two-Five. We’ll also be launching a Think Alike Productions website where you’ll have the option to easily download the Digital copy of Issue One as well as any future Issues of I.A.M. Our plan is to produce Issues Two-Five over the course of the next few months, with our ultimate goal of releasing Volume One for people everywhere to enjoy!

How can you help us through our Indiegogo campaign? Every dollar you donate will help us reach our goal of producing Volume One of International Agency of Magic! We also expect the I.A.M. story to continue well past Volume One. We have written this as an on-going series with many plot twists, action packed panels and amazing story archs! PLEASE DONATE and help us make this goal happen, not just for us, but for every comic book reader in the world! The future of the IAM and its characters has already been created; we just need your help to keep the series alive! And if you can’t donate? Share this link! Pass it on to a friend, tell a coworker, tell anyone and everyone about International Agency of Magic!

 Spreading the word about this campaign is free for you and priceless for us!

If you can donate, our team has thought up some great perks for you, including exclusive art drawn by the incredible Stan Chou! You can even see yourself in the pages of our comic book, as a character that you can help design! What is cooler than that? Please check out the complete list of all of our great perks!

Your support means everything to us! All of our social media links are listed below so please, tweet us, follow us on Instagram, like us on Facebook, share the love! 

                               Thank you, thank you, and thank you again!
story_txt:
Welcome everyone! We are Think Alike Productions, a writing team based out of Miami, Florida.
 

 
We came together one day and decided we wanted to create a book that kids and adults would both gravitate towards, something that could fill the void we felt was missing in the magical genre. This lead us to begin working on our flagship project, a comic book series titled International Agency of Magic. Over the last year, there have been many bumps in the road, but we've refused to give up until we made this idea a reality! story:
The campaign is through and finished with 7,787 Euros. Thanks to all contributors and to everyone who helped to get there!

Here is the original text from the campaign, that started on January 21st 2014 and ende on March 8th.

ONE. Graphic Lyrics is a book full of one page, mostly one panel comics that each tell a different story: Yours.

Deutsche Besucher finden ein deutsches Video und eine Übersetzung dieser Informationen auf www.graphic-lyrics.de.

(Quick note: The perks are in Euros. Approximated prices in US Dollar can be found further down in the text.)

... and this is how it works:

Besides getting the book, starting up with the third perk "Your prompt as a comic" you can give me a short prompt to get your story into the book. This could be a single word, your favorite line from your favorite song, a phrase engraved in your wedding ring. Anything that comes to your mind. And I'll take whatever you give me and use that prompt as a inspiration for a one panel comic. Choosing a higher perk you can even give me more details about your prompt and it's background.

Some examples

These are some examples of Graphic Lyrics - that's what I call these one panel comics - I already drew over time.

Higher resolution examples can be found in the gallery.

The picture will be drawn traditionally with pencil and fineliner on a DIN A3 Hahnemühle Nostalgie professional drawing board (29,7 x 42 cm) and then scanned and digitally colored. Depending on the perk you choose, you may even get the original, raw drawing - but in any case you'll get a full 50 x 70 cm poster of your picture to hang on your wall plus the book compiling yours and the stories of the other funders and much more. See below and on the right.

The book

The book will be printed in high end quality on a very good paper. It's gonna be hard cover book with a stitched binding and it will include a minimum of 120 pages with 50 or more of the full color images of your prompts, a prologue, some background information and the names of all funders who wish to be published. 

Please find a mockup on the right. 

All texts will be printed in englisch and german.

It's gonna be produced in the European Union.

The perks

In addition to the signed book itself and depending on the perk you choose you get some or all of the following:

  • A hand drawn picture inspired by your prompt or based on your briefing
  • A 50 x 70 poster of your hand drawn and digitally colored picture
  • A 50 x 70 cm poster of the cover - signed if wanted.
  • The original black and white hand drawn artwork
  • A handcolored original work of art
  • A full featured commercial license of your work
  • A visit by the artist himself
  • Your name in the back of the cover and on the website - can be opted out of course.

For a higher resolution please click here. 

All details can be found on the right.

Overview of perks and prices


Approximated prices in US Dollar

For my international funders here are the prices of the perks on the right in US Dollar.

All US-Dollar prices are approximated based on the currency exchange rates from January, 29th 2014.

  • It's a start: $7
  • The book (and more): $55
  • Your prompt as a comic: $135
  • Your prompt plus the original: $190
  • Brief me about your story: $270
  • A unique work of art: $682
  • Commercial license: $1365
  • Who are you? An angel!?: $3,414

What the funding is for

First of all of course to cover the production costs for all the printed perks like the book and the posters. Second drawing the images costs a lot of time. And the old saying says: Time is money. 

It's that simple.

And now: Stretch goals

Now that we've reached the goal of 5,000 Euros (approx. $6,830.00) I offer these two stretchgoals:

Funding reaches 7.500,00 Euros (approx. $10,224.00)

All perks - except the first - get an additional DIN A5 (14.8 x 21 cm) 48 page booklet full of notes, background information and sketches about the projekt and more pages may be added to the book

Funding reaches 10.000,00 Euros (approx. $13,660.00)

The same as above, but the format will be DIN A4 (210 x 29.7 cm). And maybe something special I am working on.

Now: Please spread the word!

Besides you choosing one (or more) perks the best you can do to help me reach my funding goal is to spread the word. Share this campaign through your virtual and real world social networks, email your friends and your mom, shout it out loud. That would be great. If you share it through Facebook and pals please write one or two sentences with your recommendation. In that case people will notice it more often than if it were just a simple click'n'share action.

The artist

Just some quick words about me: My name is Markus Freise, I am a professional designer and illustrator from Bielefeld, Germany, where I work and live with my family. "ONE." is not my first book - I already published a book with short stories and a small graphic novel. But "ONE." is my so far most ambitious book and my first crowdfunding campaign.

That's it.

Thanks for your time. Have a great day!

Markus Freise

If you share it through Facebook and pals please write one or two sentences with your recommendation. story:
SAMPLE CHAPTERS:


I've been a copy-editor for other people's books and a freelance writer for various online magazines for a little over five years now, but I never fully invested in finishing my own books until now. I decided to approach writing the Angel Dust series as if it was a job... and I'd love for you to see a sneak-peak of the story!


Chapter 1 - Peter

Chapter 2 - Beth

Chapter 3 - Board Silly

Chapter 4 - Fae Dreams

 

THE STORY:

Peter Pain is a young adult novel that tells the story of Elizabeth Davies, a 16-year-old girl, who wakes up one day in an alternate dimension called the Never-World. This patchwork fairyland has been shaped by generations of children’s dreams, and their nightmares. With the help of Toade, a fae warrior, Beth sets out to find Peter, the only one on the island of dreams who can take her home.

This book isn't all about fairies.

During her journey Beth is stalked by ninja-pirates, kidnapped by the wild Lost Children, challenged by the jealous and deadly skin-walker Tigress Lily, and finally meets Peter, who doesn’t want her to leave the Never-World. EVER. Beth also discovers that she comes from an ancient bloodline that allows her to manifest her will and change the Never-World, just like Peter.

How will her new powers change her? Will Beth embrace her destiny as a child of angels? And how can she help lift Peter's curse so he will (maybe) let her go free?

This book is #1 in the 4-part Angel Dust series and just like the beloved Narnia series, it's got both fantasy and Christian elements. I've had the concept in my head since 2008 and finished the first draft in 2010. I finally started revising Peter Pain in June this year, and planned to use a huge chunk of each paycheck to pay my extremely talent artists and get the graphic novel going. Then I lost my job... darn economy.

Seeing how I'm not a horrible writer, I know I could find an editor to do a quick proofread for a good price and release an ebook for half the budget I'm proposing, but I envisioned bringing the Never-World to life by turning it into both an illustrated book and a graphic novel.

I'm too stubborn to let that vision go. I wanted to independently publish this book under my own imprint, called Metis-Rise, as the first of many quality books for pre-teens and young adults.


 

 

THE BREAKDOWN:

Money earned will go to covering fees, editing, development of the comic illustrations, and the incentives. Additional funds earned (beyond our goal) will be used towords finishing the graphic novel, working on the website, and towards a contribution to J.M. Barrie's beloved charity,the Great Ormond Street Hospital. 

If the demand and support is high enough, we'll reach some awesome stretch goals, and I'll start working on the Angel Dust Chronicles full time. If I don't reach my entire goal, the funds will go towards getting as much of the book illustrated as possible.

Art: The books are illustrated, and there is a digital graphic novel in the works. Though my artists are awesome, they can't afford to give away the art for free. How fair is that? I'm going to have roughly 20 pictures (one for each chapter) in the book. And 20 additional pages for the comic. That's pretty expensive. So my budget for art is roughly a third of the funds I'm raising.

Editing: I'm a freelance writer and I edit other people's books, so I understand the importance of getting a book proof-read before releasing it to the masses. I admit, I miss mistakes in my own writing all the time. Every writer does. So I'm budgeting for proofreading and a little copyediting for a 60,000 word book, about $3 for 200 pages.

Formatting: It isn't very expensive, but it's needed. I want to get Peter Pain properly formatted for different types of e-readers and print. It shouldn't cost more than a couple hundred dollars.

Indie Go-Go Swag: I'm putting aside $500 for t-shirts, posters, bookmarts, and more! I'm doing a limited print run of 6x9 B&W illustrated novels for everyone who pledges $35 through $74. This costs about $6 per unit. The hardcover special editions will be ordered only for the people who pledge $75 and up.

Fees: Indiegogo and Paypal charges about 8% for their part in the fundraising. So when we raise $3500, they will get  about $300 of the balance right off the top.

 

ART FOR YOUNG ADULTS:

In the early 1900's, authors like Lewis Carrol (Alice in Wonderland), Frank Baum (Wizard of Oz), C.S. Lewis (The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe) and J.M. Barrie (Peter Pan) released beautiful iconic books, full of black and white pictures along with the text and some color illustrations at the end of every chapter. With the popularity of books like The Diary of a Wimpy Kid Series, I realized pre-teens who read chapter books love seeing as well as reading. I decided to create a novel that has pictures for a slightly older age group. It's a little like mixing a graphic novel and a book together. I found a couple of wonderful artists who were willing to squeeze me into their schedules, and we did some concept art on what Peter, Beth, Lily, and the Lost Ones will look like. Marcus and Zach are willing to turn my story into a bunch of artistic images and a graphic novel, so we can build the Never-World visually.

 

YOU CAN HELP:

I have friends and family in New England that I wish I could help after Hurricane Sandy. With so much turmoil out there in the world... my team and I agreed that 30% of every penny raised over the $4000 goal should go towards a charity (net: after Indiegogo fees). 

So we are going to contribute 30% towards GOSH in rememberance of the original Peter Pan story written by James Barrie. The hospitial was awesome enough to give me the green light on this project so I really wanted to give back. 

I hope that you will support my project, because supporting Peter Pain also helps children in need.

PLEASE SHARE this link and tell others about the book!

 

 

STRETCH GOALS:

I’d really like to make sure the Never-World comes alive in terms of comics but this measly $3500 will only fund part of the illustration budget!

If the Angel Dust novel project is successful on Indiegogo and makes a $8,000 stretch goal, I’ll finish Volume #1 (50+ pages) of the digital Angel-Dust comic and turn it into a print graphic novel! Anyone who pledges $50 or more will be able to buy the book at "cost" from the online store. Which means, whatever it cost to print 'em will be the amount you shell-out. This way, I won't have to create a new Indiegogo project when it's time for the graphic novel to come to life!

If we make a stretch goal of $12,000 we will invest in web-design so we can release weekly comic updates along with character profiles, short stories, and more. As you can see, the current website isn't very fancy. (www.peterpain.webs.com.) I just slapped something online so I could say I have one and it's in desperate need of an overhaul. Making this goal will help us create a slamming website so Angel Dust stories can be presented online as an ongoing web-comic. I'm thinking to hire my good friends at Eclipse web-media in Atlanta. They promised to do an awesome job! (http://www.eclipsewebmedia.com/)

If we make the unheard of amount of $20,000 dollars, not only will that fund the 2nd book, we will also be able to reserve a booth at DragonCon 2013 and feature a bunch of Angel Dust swag featuring Beth, Peter, Lil, and the whole gang! Me, Marcus, and Zach will be there, ready to shake everyone's hand. We will probably be selling books and prints you guys at Indiegogo have already had for a year! By this time, the 2nd installment of the novel series “Darling Girl” should be printed... so cross-your fingers guys. Lets make this goal happen!


Thank you for your generosity and support!

story:
The Graphic Novel

"This new action-adventure series features a dynamic, visually driven story about four talented teenagers of different cultures who triumph over extraordinary circumstances to form a musical group called C2 & PÓSSE (pronounced Cee-Squared)". 

"While performing, they stumble upon an evil plot to destroy life on earth. As they investigate, they discover the Intergalactic legion of Evil™ (ILOE-pronounced i-lo), the sinister empire dedicated to spreading evil and destroying life as we know it, throughout the Galaxy". 

"ILOE’s wicked Imperial Warlord, with his Storm Trooper Androids, Generals and Covert Agents, destroyed life on all the planets in our solar system except earth. 

Now earth is their next target. The salvation of all humanity rests on the broad shoulders of C2 & PÓSSE: Inner-City Heroes." 


The Characters

Clarence Collins II - nicknamed C2™(pronounced Cee-Squared) is an African-American and is the Posse’s leader and resident scientist, utilizing his keen knowledge of mathematics, he creates all the hip scientific hardware they use from recycled trash. He also raps, loves Hip-Hop and R&B, plays piano and keyboards and produces the group’s phat soundtrack.

 

Spoony-Breeze™ is a Caucasian-American and is real cool and real quick. His nose twitches when there’s danger. He plays drums, paints and loves Jazz, Urban-Contemporary Music, basketball and golf. His jump-shots are legendary in the neighborhood.

 

Glow™ is an Asian-American who’s jovial and energetic with a distinctively infectious laugh and a glowing personality. Though a little on the chubby side, he is a physically superior athlete and martial arts expert who loves to eat. He plays tenor saxophone, loves Michael Jackson, Elvis Presley and Rock and Roll.

 

Peppermint-T™ is a Latin-American and is the stylish and sassy informational specialist that monitors the airwaves (audio/video) for ILOE related disturbances. On the science tip, she’s a whiz and cracks computer access codes with her special skills and hardware. She’s got a green-thumb, plays guitar and sings love songs, but please don’t be fooled...she’s no wimp! She’s got a powerful right cross and is not afraid to fight for the truth!


The Impact

The first book (premiere episode #4) in this series is called: "Caught in the Mix" (20 pages in full color) ISBN: 978-1-934938-04-1, and was published in January 2009.  During book fairs, kids & teens were captivated by the art and the story. When teachers got a good look at it, they immediately realized that this was really quite different than what they were use to seeing. This made them want to use it in the classroom. 

Creatively, we have invented a story and characters that achieve all of the same explosive action and adventure of traditional graphic novels, but without the gratuitous violence. We focus on substance and values -  because we know that everything is learning!

One teacher in particular purchased books for her school and now has become the official educational advisor for the C2 & Posse series. She created a Guided Reading Lesson Plan (for Episode #4) for teachers and parents. So now, each episode will have a lesson plan companion to help teachers and parents utilize C2 & Posse inside & outside of the classroom.

"The fact that teachers recognize C2 & Posse as a tool to inspire their students is a dream come true for me and it motivates our team to do even more".

"C2 & Posse encourages kids & teens to read, but also reaches their hearts and captures their imaginations with contemporary themes & culture, bright colors and spectacular page layouts".

With each episode the C2 & Posse characters realize that when they develop & utilize their CODES4LIFE™ - it gives them the Super-Power to compete with ILOE's alien powers.

The CODES4LIFE is a hip, new, creative and exciting way for kids & teens to discover the importance of developing human values that produce healthy minds and create great citizenship, while being entertained in an action adventure graphic novel.        

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $4,000. This covers a limited first printing of "Ready or Not... Here we Come!" and helps cover some of the cost of developing the artwork and its Guided Reading Lesson Plan.

This new book (Episode #5) is called: "Ready or Not... Here we Come!"(40 pages in full color) picks up where Episode #4 Caught in the Mix! (the Premiere Issue) leaves off.

".... Android robots of the evil empire are in hot pursuit. C2 & Posse, now realizes that if they are caught – they will be eliminated! Peppermint-T snatches what appears to be an alien computer chip. They discover a new clue that reshapes their view of reality like never before. A new CODES4LIFE is uncovered!".


High Quality Books 

All of the C2 & Posse: Inner-City Heroes books are created with the very best materials. Our books are larger (8.5"W x 11"H) than traditional graphic novels and comic books (6.75"W x 10.25"H). 

"Each book includes a first page vellum insert sheet especially for autographing, is perfect bound(no staples) and is printed in full color with many pages that are full page bleeds on high quality glossy paper. The suggested retail price of this collectable graphic novel book is $16.95".

 

For your support, we have some really cool Perks and as we grow - there will be a whole lot more for you too. You can contribute by PayPal or by credit card.

So tell all your friends and love ones that a graphic novel that actually portrays inner-city teenagers as Heroes is here to inspire all of our youth.


If you can't contribute, please help us by spreading the word! 
Every time you share C2 & Posse: Inner-City Heroes with someone personally & online - it really helps our campaign! Check back often, because we will share new art & additional page previews as we progress!

Feel free to visit the C2 & Posse website to view and read about the Inner-City Heroes.

"Waking up mankind... One mind at a time!"

C2 & Posse: Inner-City Heroes
story_txt:
The Graphic Novel


"This new action-adventure series features a dynamic, visually driven story about four talented teenagers
of different cultures who triumph over extraordinary circumstances to form a
musical group called C2 & PÓSSE (pronounced Cee-Squared)". 
"While performing, they stumble upon an
evil plot to destroy life on earth. As they investigate, they discover the Intergalactic
legion of Evil™ (ILOE-pronounced i-lo), the sinister
empire dedicated to spreading evil and destroying life as we know it,
throughout the Galaxy". 
"ILOE’s wicked Imperial Warlord, with his Storm Trooper
Androids, Generals and Covert Agents, destroyed life on all the planets in our
solar system except earth. 
Now earth is their next target. The salvation of all
humanity rests on the broad shoulders of C2 & PÓSSE: Inner-City Heroes." 





The Characters
Clarence Collins II - nicknamed C2™(pronounced Cee-Squared) is an African-American and is the Posse’s
leader and resident scientist, utilizing his keen knowledge of mathematics, he
creates all the hip scientific hardware they use from recycled trash. He also
raps, loves Hip-Hop and R&B, plays piano and keyboards and produces the
group’s phat soundtrack. 
Spoony-Breeze™ is a Caucasian-American and is real cool
and real quick. His nose twitches when there’s danger. He plays drums, paints
and loves Jazz, Urban-Contemporary Music, basketball and golf. His jump-shots
are legendary in the neighborhood. 
 
Glow™ is an Asian-American who’s jovial and energetic with a
distinctively infectious laugh and a glowing personality. Though a little on
the chubby side, he is a physically superior athlete and martial arts expert who
loves to eat. He plays tenor saxophone, loves Michael Jackson, Elvis Presley
and Rock and Roll. 
 
Peppermint-T™ is a Latin-American and is the stylish
and sassy informational specialist that monitors the airwaves (audio/video) for

story:
What is this all about?

Hello, my name is Milton and I'm a computer engineer from Venezuela, South America, I also run the blog SuperheroesInColor on tumblr.  Even living in latinoamerica there's no doubt that the portrayal of Latinos in mainstream media outside our borders shape the way we see ourselves, so I started this blog last year to focus on the positive and empowering portrayals of the underrepresented. 

To quote Black Nerds problems:

"Explaining to others why under represented people, need POSITIVE representation of themselves gets old fast. Real fast."

SuperheroesInColor is dedicated to racial and cultural diversity in comic books and related mediums (TV, film, games etc.).  SuperheroesInColor showcases people of color as heroes, fully-realized characters; we celebrate their often-overlooked adventures, creators and histories. We see the cultural differences in characters as opportunities to educate trough the comic medium.

We regularly feature interesting reading material and fun facts about POC characters in genre culture, cosplay, independent creations and authors that are sorely unrepresented on many superhero blogs. Representation of the full spectrum of comics diversity is SuperheroesInColor 's main mission. 

[Watson And Holmes, New Paradigm Studios] 

Recently, SuperheroesInColor suffered the catastrophic loss of our PC- along with all the research and imagery we'd been archiving over the last 9 years. For now, we're working as best we can by borrowing tech whenever we have a chance but obviously that's not a true solution. Our future is in peril! WE need some superheroes!!!

So here is your mission (should you choose to accept it!): Help restore SuperheroesInColor to it's former glory as a haven for under-represented champions- and, who knows, possible help boost us to greater heights!

[Independent publishers and authors I want to keep sharing ]

What We Need & What You Get

The money will go to:

  • Purchase new computer setup + the shipping fees.
  • External Hard Drive to keep regular backups (don't want that last experience again)
  • Hosting and domain (2 years), so I can have a separate more focused site alongside the current tumblr blog.
  • A blog theme
  • INDIEGOGO FEES + PAY PAL fees +credit card fees 
  • Perks rewards costs. 
If the campaign happen to go beyond the initial goal the next milestone would be a limited series of video posts focused on comic book characters and after that another series about authors and artists from the past and present.

The Perks

[Art by the super talented Nana Walls]

[Art by the super talented Danielle Saiz

*All rewards are digital comics

story:
INTRODUCTION

Thimphu Comics, the first comic studio in Bhutan, was founded in 2013 by artist Pema Tshering. Our maiden project "GARPA: The Attendant" is now ready for print, and we need your help to bring it to life. GARPA is an action packed comic, with themes of heroism, passion, love and loyalty. It is based on the Bhutanese legend of Garba Lungi Khorlo, or the attendant that "ran like the wind." 

We have been working passionately on the comic for 1.5 years, fueled only by our love for comics and the vision to produce one of the first comics from Bhutan. Without financial support, we have reached this far, and now we need a little help from you to take the final step and go to print. Please help Garpa finish his mission. 


IMPACT

By helping to bring this comic to print, you are not only joining us in the exciting journey of producing one of the first comic books from Bhutan, but you are also:

-Going to receive exciting rewards, including a copy of the comic (the 50$ package), and paintings, sketches, and more.

-Supporting contemporary art and artists in Bhutan

- Bringing Bhutanese comics to Bhutanese readers and youth and helping Bhutanese  re-connect with their historical and cultural past, in a time when Western media continue to saturate the market 

- Encouraging Bhutanese youth to pursue creative and meaningful vocations and forms of employment

- Helping to promote Bhutanese cultural and historical themes on a global platform

- Helping to nurture a new comic voice for the world to enjoy

We hope you will join us on this journey. Garpa, can run at the speed of wind, but he needs your help for the final dash. 


THE STORY

"GARPA: The attendant" is inspired by a legendary Bhutanese character called Garba Lungi Khorlo. It is believed that Garba Lungi Khorlo could run at the speed of wind, and was the official message "courier" or attendant for the ruling leaders. The comic book story uses this character, and creates a fictional story set in the 1800s Bhutan. 

WHAT THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR

The bulk of the funds will be used for the printing costs of "GARPA: the Attendant" Volume 1.

Extra funds will also be used for reimbursement of equipment (computers, tablets), which have been purchased on a loan, and any remaining funds will go towards producing Vol 2. of "GARPA: the attendant."

WHO WE ARE

Pema Tshering is a working artist, illustrator, designer and the founder of Thimphu Comics. In 1998, he started learning art at VAST Bhutan, the only contemporary art center in Bhutan,  under the guidance of Asha Kama, and other VAST founders. His art has been exhibited in Bhutan, Bangladesh, Thailand, Maldives, Singapore and Japan. He has also honed his storytelling skills by writing and directing two short films, which have been screened in international film festivals and events. Pema has also produced short animations and has illustrated multiple childrens books. He is a founding member of VAST Bhutan, and also one of the art instructors there.

Pema Tshering recently was selected for an art residency program in Japan (The Fukuoka Asian Art Triennale) where he worked with a Japanese manga artist to produce the first Bhutanese-Japanese Manga Comic which was exhibited in the Fukuoka Asian Art Museum. 

Wang Rana Gurung completed his 12th standard in 2011. Since then he has been pursuing his passion in art. He has illustrated 3 children's books in the past three years and is currently teaching art part-time in an early learning center. Wang Rana Gurung also completed a short course in animation and hopes to eventually get a degree in art. Wang Rana Gurung is working with Thimphu Comics on the "GARPA: the attendant” project as a digital colorist and painter.

Tempa Rabgay is a working artist, painter and animator . He has a BA degree in Journalism and a diploma in graphic design. His passion is in illustration and animation.  In 2012, Tempa Rabgay also took a course in animation from a Danish animator and director, Paw Raven. He has been involved in Thimphu Comics ever since, where he works as the character designer, story- board artist and inker. 

IF YOU CAN'T SUPPORT FINANCIALLY

If you are unable to support us financially, we would still greatly appreciate if you could spread the word, and promote our campaign. Thank you for your help! 

CONTACT

If you have any questions or concerns, please do get in touch with artist Pema Tshering at tintindorjee@gmail.com

Follow us on facebook "THIMPHU COMICS." Also, If you would like to see some of Pema Tshering's other art work, please visit his facebook page "WATER DRAGON GALLERY"

story:
IWMFH is a comic created by R.S. Shesto with art by RJ Gonzalez, former DC/Marvel and currently IDW comics inker and Nick Nestor an amazing freelance illustrator.

It will be a 31 page full color comic, we need funds for printing and distributing it.

Local comic book shops have already shown interest in retailing IWMFH.

Local talents have lent their likeness for character concepts and we have artists and team members involved from around the world.


 The first issue takes place a year after the mysterious resurrection of Peponaugh C. Fool'sfire, who is a struggling vaudevillian performer with a dark past and homicidal appetite.

The FBI, local authorities, and the countries top criminal profiler have joined forces to try and figure out whom or what is responsible for these Halloween themed murders that have occurred over the past year.

Due to the unsolved slayings, Halloween has been forbidden. Like alcohol during prohibition, anything related to the holiday is illegal. Despite being punishable by death, the police have their hands full with costume wearing rebels that disregard the consequences.To deal with the resistance, the mayor set up the Anti-Halloween Task Force.                                  

                                                                                         


Besides our 2 amazing artists, we have several members who are contributing some fantastic rewards for you to score and help us reach our goal of making this comic a reality.
The money we raise will be going to print physical copies of the comic, pay the amazing artists, the extra perks and those pesky fees that everyone has to deal with.   
                                        Check out our joint cover by Nick and Rj!
                                           

Our artists are in different countries and we have been working diligently with them daily to produce the amazing results you see in our cover.  There are some major challenges in working long distance 

Help us get the word out about I Was Myself for Halloween.  Word of mouth helps a lot.    

Check out and like us on facebook    facebook.com/iwmfh 

and follow us on twitter   twitter.com/iwmfh

story:
UPDATE!

Campaign ended and didn't got all fund, but we got enough money to give all the perks to all the people who pledged, so dont Worry!
Books will be ready by February 15 or earlier, I will contact everyone who got any physical perk for your shipping info, so don't worry ;)
Thank you for your support
All digital perks will be sent between January 1st and January 15th
-Jose


Hi everyone! My name is Jose Garcia and Seasons is my first personal graphic novel.

Seasons is a compilation of 4 wordless love stories that happen around the Seasons of the year!
Each one has its own mood and peace, its based solely on feelings so I intend that each reader interpretation depends on his or her mood, and that by reading it in different ocassions, the story's meaning change!




I've done this project last year in my spare time, it's been finished for quite a while and I thing now is the time to finally print it.
The book consist in 120 colored pages plus covers, I need your help to get it printed so I can get it sold at cons, internet, and that it helps me to make more books in the future!
This would be the first book in a series of 9, with your help, if this one succeeds I can begin to think on moving to the next and maybe having 2 books a year!




    THE GOAL

    The goal is to make enough money to print 100 copies of the book!
    Printing is real hard a expensive for a single author to handle, so I ask you to help me make this dream come true.
    Im in Mexico, so $2800 usd would totally help me to get the first 100 printed in full color, and with the profits of the book, I'll invest it on printing another 100 and so on until I get the finances to work on, and print book 2, 3 and 4.


      WHAT YOU CAN GET!
      -Credits: your name on the book!
      -Seasons PDF
      -Exclusive Wallpaper
      -Older comics PDF
      -Signed Printed book
      -Exclusive Sticker pack
      -A3 exclusive Seasons Prints
      -A3 Prints of other artworks done by me.
      -Original sketch commission inside the book!
      -Original digital portrait of you in Seasons style!
      -PSD original files!
      -Original Watercolor drawings!
      -Personalized 1 page minicomic full color of anything you like!


      The Author:
      Hey guys, my name is Jose Garcia, I've been working as a freelance artists trying to make a living and getting personal projects out in the world.
      Im from Mexico city and Im trying to get as many comics out there!
      Speaking of comics, here are some links to my personal art pages and webcomics around the net:

      Tumblr: http://radtasticalcore.tumblr.com
      DA: http://sdex.deviantart.com
      Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/JoseGarciaArtworks
      Webcomics while you wait ;)
      My 8 Bit Story: http://my8bitstory.com
      Beren (only in spanish but soon in english): http://berencomic.com
      This ones are updated weekly, sometimes 3 to 5 updates per week so you can get yourself entretained!

      THANK YOU
      Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. In order to reach the goal, we need to share this project as much as possible:share the following pages on Facebook or Twitter, or even simply by e-mailing a friend!

      Thank you! and many many thanks for making this project come to life <3

      I'll be uploading the campaign goals adding more images so it would be more appealing and maybe reach more people <3


      Love you guys <3 <3 <3
