$25 is an important level. That’s where you get the printed book (signed and personalized) as well as everything for the levels above.
$100 is for the art collectors (and game players). It gets you the original art for a Galaxion playing card. It takes the character sketch to a whole new level. There’s a limit of 54 of them, though (to allow for jokers). And, if we manage to get 52 takers, we’re committed to making them into real decks and we’ll send a deck along, too.
$250 is for the completists. There have been three different versions of Galaxion in print. This gets you all of them, as well as everything else we can lay our hands on that Tara published! (It also gets you an Amy Unbounded story from NYT bestselling and award-winning author Rachel Hartman (Seraphina)
$600 is for those who love to see themselves in print. Add yourself to the crew of the Galaxion!

In addition, we’ll be unlocking bonus perks to add to what you’re getting as we reach various milestones. Each time we reach a milestone, we’ll add it to the level and announce the next. To start off with, here’s the first:


When we are 50% funded, we’ll add e-books of volumes 1 and 2 for everyone who has supported at least $10. Instead of just getting volume 3, you get all of them. It should make it easier to catch up, if this campaign is your introduction to Galaxion. ACHIEVED!


When we are 75% funded, we'll add a couple of buttons and a bookmark for everyone who has supported at least $25. Tara has been working on diversifying her sales items for when she goes to conventons. One thing she’s been adding are buttons and bookmarks. Of course, there are Galaxion buttons. But there are other buttons as well: Fracking Geologists (in BSG font), EPIC FIAL, Save Ferris, Dendarii Mercenary or Ivan for Emperor, Big Damn Hero, Un(obtainium) or Ex(plodium), a whole raft of Minecraft buttons, etc. ACHIEVED!





When we are 100% funded we will add a signed colour print for everyone who has supported at least $100. The print will show a never-before-seen alternate of the painting that we used for the first printing of Volume 1 - one that Tara now says she prefers to the one we went with. ACHIEVED!


When we are 125% funded we will add a "Volume 3: In the Making" digital book (PDF) for everyone who has supported at least $10. What is this "In the Making" you ask? It's a collection of the script and all of the penciled pages that preceded the inked and toned pages that you'll already be getting. See how the story progressed from script to pencils to final inks - and what changed along the way. We've got the scripts. We've got scans of just about all of the pencils (we're missing a five page stretch, I admit, but we can fill at least some of that in with the thumbnails). And we'll see if we can find anything else good to throw in to make up for the missing pages. For anyone interested in the process of making comics, this is the perk bonus for you! ACHIEVED!


When we are 150% funded we will add a "Galaxion: The Salmagundi Years" digital book for everyone who has supported at least $10. As we say above, Galaxion got its as a comic start 20 years ago at the Chicago Comicon. Tara and her cousin Franz got together and produced a small photocopied comic called Salmagundi. It was a flip book with one side being Galaxion and the other side Franz's comic Vagabond. It ran for seven issues before Tara left to move to full-size professionally printed comics. I'll scan in the Galaxion stories from these issues so you can see how the comic got its start - and how far Tara has come! ACHIEVED!


When we are 175% funded we will have characters answer a question for everyone who has supported at least $50. As we've promised, all books will come signed and personalized. However, if you are at the Ensign level and above, you can submit a question (within reason) to one of the characters. Tara will sketch a small headshot of that character by the signature in Volume 3 and have him or her answer the question for you. ACHIEVED!


When we are 200% funded we will add a brand new GALAXION short story to the bundle for everyone who has supported at least $10. After Tara has completed all of the playing cards she has committed to drawing, she'll create the new GALAXION short story. We'll turn it into a PDF and send it along.

How you know the book will ship
This isn’t our first time printing Galaxion. This is Volume 3. We’ve done this twice before (more if you count earlier versions) and we know what it takes. The comics are all done. The book is assembled. We have the quote from the printer. All we are waiting for is your contribution to lighten the load and help pay the bills.
Other Ways You Can Help
But your financial contribution isn’t the only way you can help. We need all the help we can get spreading the word! Share the campaign on social media sites (Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Pinterest, Google+ or all of them). Send emails to friends and family with links to the Indiegogo page or the video. This is a great opportunity for people to join the ranks of Galaxion-readers – especially with that first bonus perk!

story:
In Darkness

In darkness is a graphic novel, created and written by Salvador Armijo. This is his first attempt on writing and publishing a book on his own.

It’s a black and white horror/action book and as far as we know the first of it’s kind to come out Norway. 

 Some early sketching of the first act. Here we see Snorre, finishing a beating of a poor guy up to a pulp.(Pic. taken on my gnarly couch) 

 The Story

  •  The story evolves around our two main characters, Kent and Snorre. They both are petty criminals trying to make a big bust. They’ve kidnapped the daughter of a bigshot corporate. Hoping to get their claws on 2.000.000 $ in ransom. After getting duped from their money, they take to the woods. Oblivious to the fact that a hit has been put on both their heads. And a darker even deadlier threat that lurks in the forrest.  

Main location for the story. tipping the hat to one of the best horror series EVER! 

The Writer

  • - Salvador Armijo is a Norwegian born Chilean. He graduated from NISS – Filmschool in Oslo, Norway. He graduated as a documentary director and has training in storytelling.
  • From an early age, Salvador Armijo got into comic books. Always amazed on how they could tell a story, so simple, yet so detailed in just one page. He is also a dedicated fan of 70’s and 80’s grindhouse and horror movies. He has been a dedicated musician since he was 19, playing drums and as a vocalist for several bands, most known for his work with the death metal band, Thy Forsaken and the punk band, Salmon Hall.

 

The illustrator

- Jon Didrik Jacobsen is a Norwegian artist that rocks a moustache like nobody else. Salvador and he met at film school were they made a documentary together. Ever since their collaboration has known no end. Currently, Jon Didrik is attending art-school in Oslo, where he time and time again gets awarded for his art. Jon D. is always drawing, either it be on a napkin or on a wall, his style is unique and he’s a master of black and white art!

One of the main Antagonists in the book, meet the, Gun weilding-loud mouthed-beer-drinking-cigarette smoking-beefcake-mercenary-redneck, that, Rocks a Tom Selleck-stash: Johnny

Why fund?

  • - This could be a mayor step for both Salvador Armijo and the Norwegian comic book community. As far as our research goes, there has never been any work similar to this made out of this country. By funding this project you will also be helping to realise a life long dream for both the writer/creator and the illustrator.
  • - You would be part of Norwegian comic book history, and that is pretty damn sweet!

The money, where does it go?!

  • - Seeing as Norway is one of the most expensive countries in the world, it does cost a lot to print out books with paperbacks and hardcovers. Most of the money is going to printing. We’re aiming to print out 500 books, both in Norwegian and English. in total 300 paperbacks and 200 hardcovers, where 100 of each is in Norwegian. and this comes inn on about 19 000 NOK, that’s about 3000 USD. We are asking for approx. half the amount and that would help us with utilities, printing and some of the will go to promotion. If by chance we do get 3000 or more. We would be eternally grateful. And would make a short clip thanking everybody involved, that we post up on vimeo and youtube.

What If you don’t achieve full funding?

  • - Well, the money is still going into the comic.  Depending on the amount of money you all donate. It will either go to help us with printing or for supplies for the art. Even if we do NOT achieve our goal. All the perks will be rewarded, no doubt about that!

What if I can’t help with money?

  • - If you can’t help by funding, no worries, you can always help us spread the word about this! The more that know about it the better. Not only would you let your friends know, but doing so, they would tell their friends and so on and so on. Please share us on facebook and tweeter and help us conquer the world!

story:
Short Summary

Into every generation is born a legendary duo. Some use their power for good, and some use their power for not-good. Warren D. and Billy D. are two songwriters who use our power for not-good. Together, we are Black & White Cookies. 

There's plenty of music out there to get you into the holiday spirit. It's early November and you're probably already hearing it on the radio. That's not what we do. 

Our holiday music involves inappropriate use of egg nog, songs like "All I Want for Christmas is my Leg," and an audience full of drunken miscreants. And we want to capture this on CD, at a high-end recording studio, so that our fans (a.k.a. BWC Stalkers) can enjoy the Black & White Cookies Holiday experience for years to come. 

By contributing to this campaign, you will help us stage two live shows on the same day (December 20, 2014) in a high-end Manhattan recording studio (Terminus Studios). We'll give you our holiday show, performed in front of a live studio audience and recorded at CD quality. 

What We Need & What You Get

It takes more money than you would think to encourage an audience to drink spiked egg nog and then pee their pants laughing at good, quality comedy. In fact, it's going to cost about $4,000. Here's how it will be used: 

  • $1,800 - to rent the studio and hire a studio engineer to record the performance. 
  • $600 - to mix and master the album.
  • $1,100 - to produce CD's and marketing materials. 
  • $500 - to cover misc. show expenses (Santa suit, many gallons of egg nog, performers in elf costumes)
  • If we raise more than the needed $4,000, we will put the remainder towards the cost of recording our THIRD Black & White Cookies album/live show. 
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will still record the show, but we're probably going to have to use tape recorders from 1983 and record it in our parents' basement. (The show would only be available on cassette or 8-track.) 

Cool Perks

Check out the "Perks" page to see all the things we've offered-- ranging from an advance download with bonus content, all the way up to a BWC-hosted party, and we've even thrown in Billy D's prosthetic leg!*
*I still haven't asked Billy if that's OK. But I'm sure he's fine with it. 

The Impact

This is all about creating an experience for our fans... I mean Stalkers. The whole purpose of doing this show in a recording studio is so that (1) the sound quality is unparalleled; and (2) because we have a huge live room to work with, and professional equipment, we can mic the audience as well as the band, and bring you directly into our performance. 

Risks & Challenges

This isn't brain surgery. We just want to make a killer album, and do it right. We know the cost, we know the right way to do this, and we've got a proven track record for pulling off a consistently amazing, high-level show (or so our fans, musical peers, and many club owners have told us). (Except for that one show in Bridgeport, but our lawyers say we can't talk about that.)

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you live in NYC and want to be part of our street team, send us a message and let us know!
  • If you can't make it to the show but you know someone who really, really should, please forward this to them. 
  • If you see Billy D. on the street, please feel free to buy him an iced coffee. He likes that. Extra milk and two Splenda.

story:
Athens: the comic book

Athens: the comic book is a collection of short stories inspired by Athens - the chaos, the beauty, the darkness, diversity and hope found in this great city. We sent an open call for stories, gave freedom to participants to choose their theme, and received 16 fantastic, romantic, realistic, social, and above all true experiences.

About us  Alternative Tours of Athens (www.atathens.org) 

The Alternative Tours of Athens (ATA) are a team of architects, photographers, artists and musicians who organize open, educational, informative and entertaining tours in Athens.

Through a wide variety of alternative tours, the ATA promotes Athens'architecture, street and public art, social movements, bike routes, nightlife, and creative local workshops. The ATA also publishes printed and electronic guides of Athens, co-organizes cultural events and educational seminars.

By showcasing Athens' diverse communities, alternative landmarks, and modern city life, the ATA aims to promote culture and tourism, increasing the interaction between visitors, local residents and urban spaces.

The ATA is always working with new talent and unique ideas that bring together cultural, tourist and scientific agencies or organizations, with local businesses, training centers, authors, artists and other people that make up the bustling Greek capital.

The Idea

With Athens in the background, or playing a central role, we want to showcase her in different ways and from different viewpoints and experiences.

We aim to publish the collection of stories directly into 2 languages, in Greek and English. We feel that this collection will touch Greeks and non-Greeks alike, those who want to see a different narrative of the city.

We hope that this publication will help promote new authors, and bring Greek comics further outwards into the world. That's why the collection includes both renowned artists as well as talented beginners taking their first steps.

We wish this anthology to become regular (i.e. annual), in order to reflect different moments as well as viewpoints in the city of Athens.

We Need Your Help!

We need 1500 Euro as starting capital in order to be able to publish an initial run in both the English and Greek language.

size 17 x 24 cm, 88 pages

the authors/artists:

Smar, Fotizontas, Nikos Papamihail, Giorgos Tsardanidis, Kristel Pent, Katerina Stamati

Kristel Pent, Eleni Georgatsou, Ismini Epitropou, Captain Jimmy, Giorgos Tsiamantas, Giorgos Tsardanidis


It’s a team work that has brought together the authors, who collaborated, decided collectively and also organized the exhibition “City/Comics”.


The ATA team is in charge of editing, graphic design and distribution of the anthology, while the artists will help promote it.


The profits from the book will be divided amongst the artists and ATA equally, while a portion of the proceeds will be donated for the homeless, through the Greek NGO “Klimaka” (http://www.klimaka.org.gr/newsite/).

The Impact

This is not just another comic collection. We want to showcase the many different aspects of Athens. It’s also important to help Greek authors register the many realities of this city, the imagery, the love, to give them a voice that asks the questions we ask each other nowadays.

Risks & Challenges

We are new to this business, but very big fans of graphic novels and comics.

Self-publishing has its difficulties, but many of the artists insisted on this specific method, wanting to work differently and with more autonomy, by following a fanzine philosophy.

Over the past few months, the authors and the ATA team have been hard at work making their vison a reality.

If you can’t help us financially, help us to spread the word!!

story:
HER PAST IS ERASED. HER FUTURE IS SET. HER PRESENT IS A LIE.

 

 

Camille has been living in space for the last three years. She has no memory of how she got there, who she is, or life before she woke up. All she knows is this: Earth has been destroyed and she is one of fifty other survivors who are part of something only known as Project Genesis. 

Camille is burdened with so many questions. Only until she meets Aaron Striker does she realize that everything she has been told has been a lie. One question lingers between the two...

 

WHO IS THE ENTITY?

 

In this 100+ page Sci-fi graphic novel, you will follow Camille in her journey to find out who The Entity is, or what it is, and to uncover the memories of her past that are crucial to saving humanity. 

 

 

 

The creators are not clueless on how to (a) run a comic campaign (b) make comics and (c) most importantly, DELIVER a comic. Tyler Carpenter, the writer and creator of ENTITY has fulfilled 3 graphic novel campaigns, both delivering on time. Artist Jo Wong brings superb art to the book and his storytelling abilities are what make ENTITY a MUST-READ comic in 2020. 

You can watch Tyler promote the book on episodes of youtube.com/drawandtalk

 

 

Don't believe that this project is awesome!? Well. Here are a few sample pages of the art throughout the book. Line art by Jo Wong and Colors by Tyler Carpenter 

ALL 100+ PAGES OF ART AND LETTERING ARE COMPLETED!

Still don't believe us and want more of a preview? Fine. Read the first 20-pages of ENTITY at this link: https://gumroad.com/drawandtalk#qiTQD

 

 

 

 

There are THREE covers to choose from in this campaign. The first cover is the Original Cover that was supposed to be used in 2017 when the book was going to be published through Insane Comics. Cover The Variant Cover is drawn by super star artist Luigi Teruel!

 

 

 

I like to keep my rewards pretty basic. The main thing I want is for you to get the book. If you have any questions about the rewards drop me a DM on Twitter (@tyler_c_world) or on Instagram (@drawandtalk)

$9 - DIGITAL PDF: You get the full PDF version of ENTITY

$12 - DIGITAL PDF + DIGITAL DIRECTORS CUT #1: You get the full PDF of ENTITY plus the script and line art for issue #1 of ENTITY

$20 - ENTITY Physical Book: You get the physical book of ENTITY, full color, 100+ pages. 

$35 - ENTITY Variant Cover Physical Book: You get the physical book of ENTITY, full color, 100+ pages with the Luigi Teruel Cover. 

$50 - Cover Bundle: Get both physical versions of the book with both covers!

$90 - BW 11x17 Commission: Tyler will draw a character of your choice on 11x17 paper use pencil, pens, and ink. 

$110 - Color 11x17 Commission: Tyler will draw a character of your choice on 11x17 paper using pencil, pens, ink, and color brush markers.

Examples of previous artwork drawn by Tyler

 

NEW PERKS! Get the Original Art that was drawn by Tyler Carpenter to make the Trading Cards!

 

We're still having a hard time convincing you to get ENTITY? No problem! In 2017 I did a small print run to bring to cons at me. They SOLD OUT! Seriously! I don't even have a copy of the original print run that I did because someone begged me to give them the last copy. Here are some photos of those who got ENTITY the original run!

Here are a few of the pictures I took from when we sold out that week at Las Vegas Comic Con

 

 

NOW. Here's some Bonus content so you hopefully support us!

 

 

Variant Cover by Luigi Teruel

 

Main Cover drawn by Tyler Carpenter

 

Trading Card Art (A)

 

Risks and challenges

The book is 100% completed. The only risk is not having enough to print the book.

 

We raised $3273 on Kickstarter. These campaigns are going to go hand in hand. The money from these two combined campaigns will help unlock the stretch goals we have going! So so far the first 2 stretch goals are taken!

Only until she meets Aaron Striker does she realize that everything she has been told has been a lie. One question lingers between the two... WHO IS THE ENTITY? In this 100+ page Sci-fi graphic novel, you will follow Camille in her journey to find out who The Entity is, or what it is, and to uncover the memories of her past that are crucial to saving humanity.    The creators are not clueless on how to (a) run a comic campaign (b) make comics and (c) most importantly, DELIVER a comic. Tyler Carpenter, the writer and creator of ENTITY has fulfilled 3 graphic novel campaigns, both delivering on time. Artist Jo Wong brings superb art to the book and his storytelling abilities are what make ENTITY a MUST-READ comic in 2020. You can watch Tyler promote the book on episodes of youtube.com/drawandtalk  Don't believe that this project is awesome!? Well. Here are a few sample pages of the art throughout the book. Line art by Jo Wong and Colors by Tyler Carpenter ALL 100+ PAGES OF ART AND LETTERING ARE COMPLETED!Still don't believe us and want more of a preview? Fine. Read the first 20-pages of ENTITY at this link: https://gumroad.com/drawandtalk#qiTQD    There are THREE covers to choose from in this campaign. The first cover is the Original Cover that was supposed to be used in 2017 when the book was going to be published through Insane Comics. Cover The Variant Cover is drawn by super star artist Luigi Teruel!   I like to keep my rewards pretty basic. The main thing I want is for you to get the book. If you have any questions about the rewards drop me a DM on Twitter (@tyler_c_world) or on Instagram (@drawandtalk)$9 - DIGITAL PDF: You get the full PDF version of ENTITY$12 - DIGITAL PDF + DIGITAL DIRECTORS CUT #1: You get the full PDF of ENTITY plus the script and line art for issue #1 of ENTITY$20 - ENTITY Physical Book: You get the physical book of ENTITY, full color, 100+ pages. $35 - ENTITY Variant Cover Physical Book: You get the physical book of ENTITY, full color, 100+ pages with the Luigi Teruel Cover. $50 - Cover Bundle: Get both physical versions of the book with both covers!$90 - BW 11x17 Commission: Tyler will draw a character of your choice on 11x17 paper use pencil, pens, and ink. $110 - Color 11x17 Commission: Tyler will draw a character of your choice on 11x17 paper using pencil, pens, ink, and color brush markers.Examples of previous artwork drawn by Tyler NEW PERKS! Get the Original Art that was drawn by Tyler Carpenter to make the Trading Cards! We're still having a hard time convincing you to get ENTITY? No problem! In 2017 I did a small print run to bring to cons at me. They SOLD OUT! Seriously! I don't even have a copy of the original print run that I did because someone begged me to give them the last copy. Here are some photos of those who got ENTITY the original run!Here are a few of the pictures I took from when we sold out that week at Las Vegas Comic Con  NOW. Here's some Bonus content so you hopefully support us!  Variant Cover by Luigi Teruel Main Cover drawn by Tyler Carpenter Trading Card Art (A) Risks and challengesThe book is 100% completed. The only risk is not having enough to print the book. We raised $3273 on Kickstarter. These campaigns are going to go hand in hand. The money from these two combined campaigns will help unlock the stretch goals we have going! So so far the first 2 stretch goals are taken!

story:
Sullivan's Sluggers Indiegogo Campaign to Adjust for International Shipping

My name is Mark Smith.  I did Sullivan's Sluggers on Kickstarter and underestimated the costs of international shipping asking backers for just $10 a book.

The book grew in size/uprgrades to an omnibus edition and the costs of shipping (3.5 lbs) jumped up a lot with the extra weight.  International shipping prices from the USPS skyrocketed this year as well.  

I  didn't freight directly from China to the UK, EU, and AU which would have saved a lot of time and money and now I have to freight the books from California to these destinations.  All of these factors added up to a huge price jump.  

I need to raise more funds to get the book to international backers.  That's where you come in.  

I'm doing this Indiegogo campaign to raise the difference by offering the book to US backers so that I don't have to ask international backers for more and so that I can ship out the books to international backers at the original price of just $10 added for shipping.  

Each US order gets the book out to an international backer because the books are printed and there are no extra costs other than shipping and handling in the US.

I'll also be printing Sullivan's Sluggers stickers for international orders and possibly a few other extra goodies. 

My goal is to wrap up the original Kickstarter in the next two months, get this book behind me, and move on to new projects that are better planned.

I'm offering Sullivan's Sluggers for a month for US BACKERS who missed out the first time for a chance to get their own glorious 200 page Deluxe Omnibus Sized Hardcover (3.5 lbs) with a thick quality slipcase cover, a print in the inside front cover, a baseball card sheet in the inside back cover, dangling bound in ribbon bookmark, and a three page fold out monster gate fold. 

All books come shrink-wrapped.  

FOR SCALE: 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I used another campaign as a template that said to add $10 per book for international and since then rates have skyrocketed.  I also didn't ship straight from the printer in China to the UK, Europe, and Australia, making costs go up even more.

I'm doing this Indiegogo campaign to raise the difference by offering the book to US backers so that I don't have to ask international backers for more.  Each US order gets the book out to international backers.  

As of now most of the US orders are done and we're starting on shipping for Canada on the original Kickstarter.  We've got about 600 international orders left to ship.   

 

 

I'll also be printing Sullivan's Sluggers stickers for international orders and possibly a few other extra goodies. 

 

 

About 'Sullivan's Sluggers'.

Sullivan's Sluggers is a baseball horror graphic novel written by Mark Andrew Smith with art by James Stokoe (Orc Stain). 

The Story...

Long past their former glory, the minor league Sluggers get an invitation to play a baseball game in a cursed small town. After the 7th inning stretch, the sun goes down, and the dysfunctional teammates find themselves fighting for their lives against a town of flesh-eating monsters!

Now, it's up to coach Casey Sullivan to help his team escape from being the next dish in the town's terrifying feeding frenzy!

Eisner & Harvey Award-winning graphic novel author Mark Andrew Smith joins forces with Eisner nominated illustrator James Stokoe for a gripping roller coaster of a graphic novel, packed with shocks, gore, and screamingly outrageous humor, when America's Favorite Past Time becomes one team's ultimate nightmare!

Sullivan's Sluggers is a 200 page Deluxe Omnibus Sized Hardcover (3.5 lbs) with a thick quality slipcase cover, a print in the inside front cover, a baseball card sheet in the inside back cover, dangling bound in ribbon bookmark, and a three page fold out monster gate-fold. 

All books come shrink wrapped.

PANELS AND PAGES FROM SULLIVAN'S SLUGGERS

Please take a moment to share 'Sullivan's Sluggers' with your friends on Facebook and Twitter by clicking the 'Like' & 'Tweet' buttons above. 

By sharing 'Sullivan's Sluggers' you're helping our project to round the internet bases and spread the word about 'Sullivan's Sluggers' for more points!!!

PHOTOS OF SULLIVAN'S SLUGGERS PRINTED:

Sullivan's Sluggers is a 200 page Deluxe Omnibus Sized Hardcover (3.5 lbs) with a thick quality slipcase cover, a print in the inside front cover, a baseball card sheet in the inside back cover, dangling bound in ribbon bookmark, and a three page fold out monster gate fold.

All books come shrink wrapped.

FOR SCALE: 

 

THE SLIPCASE:

MONSTER GATE FOLD:

THE TOTAL PACKAGE:

story:
Who We Are

QCP Studios is a tight-knit group of independent creators from around the world dedicated to delivering exciting stories with unique & compelling characters across multiple media platforms.
We’ve noticed that there’s an exciting wave of talented artists and writers that don’t quite seem to have the audience they should, despite their best efforts. The independent comics community is bristling with new energy but a good portion of the work coming from larger publishers doesn’t seem to be reflecting that vibrancy.
To that end, we’ve decided that now is the time to launch our humble enterprise (unintended pun) in hopes that we can provide some of the craftsmanship & magic that we remember so fondly with our comics, games and animation.

We've decided to begin this venture with "Shane Longshadow is Hungry" by Stephen Patrick Kelly.

What We Need

Contributions will go to paying Steve, as well as our colorist Angela Zavala, a graphic designer for the book itself and covering the cost of printing/fulfillment of perks for our backers.

What You Get

How the funds will be used:

  • 60% Printing, 20% Artists, 20% Creation & Shipping of rewards.
  • If the project isn't fully funded, we still plan to put whatever funds we've raised toward releasing the book on our own, and all backers will receive a copy.

The Impact

Shane is the culmination of Steve's dream to be a comics creator in the vein of Siegel, Shuster or Kirby. A lifelong fan of Superman, Steve (along with his brother Chris and his father Fred) has dreamed of making comics for as long as he can remember. We believe this book is important not just to us, but to comic fans.

Risks & Challenges

Because Steve has already written and drawn volume 1 in it's entirety (which you can read here: https://tapas.io/episode/102567), the only challenges will be recoloring and printing. We've given ourselves ample time to get both completed and get perks sent out, and Steve has successfully funded a comic with his father, Fred (creator of Cosmic Tiger). We know the ropes and we're dedicated to creating a high quality product on time.

Other Ways You Can Help

If the holidays have hit you a little too hard financially, that doesn't mean you can't help. Sharing this page with your friends and family, telling your local comic book shop owner about us or just writing words of encouragement are all greatly appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

"AGAINST THE WALL" is a Graphic Novel currently in development based on the short film  www.facebook.com/againstthewallfilm

WHO I AM...

Hello, my name is Rodney Luis Aquino and I am a Writer/Director in the Film and Television Industry. I discovered my passion for the Industry while I was Deployed overseas during Iraqi Freedom in 2003. I watch all of the "Band of Brothers" episodes and was mesmerised by the quality and stories told. I later watched the Behind the scenes videos and was surprised at what it took to make these memorable images. Later when my service contract was up, I decided to separate and attend a film school located here in Orlando, Florida. I'm the ugly one in the middle...


"AGAINST THE WALL FILM

I met so many interesting fellow filmmakers and ran across a team of Martial artist/stuntmen know as: Team Enso and knew right away I had to work with them. We developed "Against the Wall" and shot the film later that year. Our workload has increased over time and finishing the film in post was been put off to finish client work. The film is currently back on the post grind and hope to have is finished by summer 2014 along with the Novel. 


"AGAINST THE WALL" Graphic Novel

The Graphic Novel is based on the short film, but before the current film. We meet the team put together by General Smith on the approval of the President. General Smith finds the best of the elite Military Special Forces of each branch:Army, Navy, Air Force and Marines to form a 4 man group of super soldiers to carry out Top Secret missions. These men are then injected with a new formula of Micro Organisms aka Nanites. The mission code named Operation: CLEANSLATE is Operational. These men are the ones who actually took out Osama Bin Laden!!!


ARE YOU UP FOR THE MISSION?

This is where we need your help. Our artist Noeland Collins is hard at work on the Novel and bills need to be paid. He deserves to be paid for his talents. He is the BIGGEST part of the partnership in "Against the Wall." We want you to be a part of the experience and help make this book a reality. We do plan on a feature length film down the road also and we want our fans to be excited like we are.

Other costs that you will help with are: Multiple prints, merchandise, delivery and etc...

What We Need & What You Get


We wanna break it down  in more detail:

  • The 5 thousand + needed will go to Artist Noeland Collins to help with all of the artwork. He's hard at work on this Novel and has to pay the bills. We also have to cover the multiple prints and etc...involved in getting it out to you.
  • We have some excellent perks for you. We have: T-shirts, stickers, autographed artwork by the artist, Rodney Luis Aquino and also some of the actors who played the roles in the short film. The best part is for the right donations, we can even add YOU to the novel!!!
  • If we don't reach our goal, no worries. We will still make it happen. All of what we raise will go toward the Novel.

The Impact

Here's where it get's really KOOL!!!

  • "AGAINST THE WALL" in the beginning was just a short film Idea we had with a few artistic pieces for story telling then it blossomed into a full blown Graphic Novel that everyone can enjoy. 
  • Even though this is our 1st Graphic Novel, we know that it will be a success. We love filmmaking and had a blast shooting the film. We want to tell the whole story and bring you along on the journey. 
  • We realize that this process is very expensive to print a full color book, but with your help we can make it happen. Noeland and I are very passionate about this Novel and hope you are too. Just wait to see what's in store. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Don't forget, if you are excited by this concept, the Indiegogo share tools are excellent means of spreading the word.
  • Spread the word on any social network page with the link attached


WEBSITES:

  • http://gunsofohio.tumblr.com/
  • https://www.facebook.com/againstthewallfilm
  • http://www.againstthewallfilm.com/
  • http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2261207/combined
  • https://twitter.com/againstthewall1
  • WWW.GOINBALLISTIC.COM
  • WWW.LEFTDIGITALMEDIA.COM
  • http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gk2lTlf0PfI

story:
Omen is about a black-hearted & disconnected man named, Frank Wade. The ultimate soldier turned ultimate sinner. Frank is a ruthless, cold-blooded, notoriously viscous man & soldier, dies on a mission. But, by way of a technicality in Heavenly law, involving the ultimate sacrifice, Frank gets a shot at redemption if he joins Sha-Khor & wears the Omen Armor. But his road will be long & hard - not just in outward struggles as he fights Cain, Lilith, the Seven Deadly Sins & the Lords of Hell, but internally as he struggles to confront his Dark past & carve out a better future.

What We Need & What You Get

This is dream fulfillment for me, so I will receive $0 until the digital sales of the comics on Amazon, Comixology & Comichause. Paying me is not the goal here.

Drawing, coloring & lettering for the 33 pages of Omen #1 will cost $2,070 to produce digitally - this is what we are trying to raise. This total covers the Cover art, title logo, interior art & lettering - some of which is already done.  If this goal is not reached, assuming we break at least $100 - the money will still go to the artist/colorist/letterer Marco Cantillana. I am determined to see Omen #1 made.

ALL CONTRIBUTORS WILL BE NAMED ON THE THANK YOU PAGE OF OMEN #1

1$ - Want to see what you're getting into before you sign on as a contributor? Get a PDF copy of the critic & pros praised Omen #1 Script by creator/writer Michael Nunneley sent immediately via email - no waiting for this perk!

$5 DIGITAL PACKAGE - A digital copy of Omen #1 upon completion, & 2 B&W character art piece (valued at $28) by Marco Cantillana.

$10 FULL COLOR, SIGNED CHARACTER ART - A full color Frank Wade aka Omen character piece signed by artist Marco Cantillana emailed to you (valued at $35)!

$15 STEP BY STEP PACKAGE A full page Step By Step (1 Pencil Page, 1 Inks Page, 1 Colors Page) process of Omen #1, Page 1 by the phenomenal Chile artist Marco Cantillana & the cover of Omen #1 by the Latvian artist Roalands Kalnins!! - sent digitally via email (valued at $60/$90).

$25 FULL CONTRIBUTOR PACKAGE - The critically & professionally praised Omen #1 script signed by creator/writer Michael Nunneley via mail, A digital copy of Omen #1 upon completion & 1 Full Color character art piece (valued at $37) from artist/colorist/letterer Marco Cantillana.

$35 EVERY BOOK IN PHASE ONE - A digital subscription to every title in Phase One of the Omenverse (Valued at $105).

$40 EXTRAS PACKAGE SIGNED COPIES - Signed, full-color cover & Frank Wade aka Omen character art by Marco Cantillana & Rolands Kalnins, Signed Omen #1 script, by M. Nunneley (creator/writer), Marco Cantillana (artist/colorist/letterer) & Rolands Kalnins (cover/logo design), Frank Wade/Omen character bio, 2 signed B&W character pieces by Marco Cantillana.

$50 ULTIMATE CONTRIBUTOR PACKAGE - A critically & professionally praised & signed Omen #1 script by creator/writer Michael Nunneley, A digital copy of Omen #1 upon completion, 1 full color Frank Wade aka Omen character art signed by artist/colorist/letterer Marco Cantillana, Step By Step Pages of Omen #1 Page 1 showing the pencils, inks & colors by Marco Cantillana, a Step By Step Cover Pages by Latvian artist Rolands Kalnins. A Character Profile of Frank Wade aka Omen, with secrets not revealed in the comics!

$75 OMEN MEGA-FAN PACKAGE - Signed Omen #1 script, Frank Wade aka Omen character art (B&W & Full Color) & cover pages - by Nunneley, Cantillana & Kalnins. step be step pages (Cantillana), character bio: Frank Wade aka Omen, & a digital subscription to all of Omen Comics titles in phase 1 (35 Issues).

The Impact

First of all, THANK YOU very much for taking the time to look at our page. Omen #1 is the first of 5 titles within the shared multiverse called Omenverse. Several pros & amateurs alike have both reviewed and praised the script for Omen #1. The most common response has been, "That was awesome! A well planned story." By contributing you are fulfilling the lifelong dreams of myself and my team - 1 of which, the artist/colorist/letterer, will make his American debut with this title (From Chile: Marco Cantillana "Hex 666" writer/artist). Not to mention getting some great characters as well as an original and entertaining story out into the indie world.

Risks & Challenges

The first hurdle in creating the Omenverse comics is paying artist/colorist/letterer Marco Cantillana for production of Omen #1 - which has already started (Marco is drawing/coloring/lettering the script RIGHT NOW! & the Cover & logo are completed).

The next hurdle has already been conquered: getting digital platforms to sell my comics - I have arranged to sell them on Amazon, Comixology & Comichause & we will have our own web comic page as well on ComicFury.

A bit about my journey here: I have wanted to make comics since I was 12 years old (1988) and I have been developing my writing and production skills through the decades including majoring in Creative Writing in college, creating comic stories and characters and even writing a fantasy novel - which has become a world in the Omen Comics multiverse. I have pursued this vocation my whole life and I have no intention of ever stopping until I am dead. I want nothing more than to write & create comics.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, times are rough for everyone these days & I fully understand not having the funds to contribute. But there are still ways you can help that will make a big difference. #1:  Get the word out on social media and make some noise about the campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools.
story_txt:
Omen is about a black-hearted & disconnected man named, Frank Wade. The ultimate soldier turned ultimate sinner. Frank is a ruthless, cold-blooded, notoriously viscous man & soldier, dies on a mission. But, by way of a technicality in Heavenly law, involving the ultimate sacrifice, Frank gets a shot at redemption if he joins Sha-Khor & wears the Omen Armor. But his road will be long & hard - not just in outward struggles as he fights Cain, Lilith, the Seven Deadly Sins & the Lords of Hell, but internally as he struggles to confront his Dark past & carve out a better future.


What We Need & What You Get
This is dream fulfillment for me, so I will receive $0 until the digital sales of the comics on Amazon, Comixology & Comichause. Paying me is not the goal here.
Drawing, coloring & lettering for the 33 pages of Omen #1 will cost $2,070 to produce digitally - this is what we are trying to raise. This total covers the Cover art, title logo, interior art & lettering - some of which is already done.  If this goal is not reached, assuming we break at least $100 - the money will still go to the artist/colorist/letterer Marco Cantillana. I am determined to see Omen #1 made.

ALL CONTRIBUTORS WILL BE NAMED ON THE THANK YOU PAGE OF OMEN #1
1$ - Want to see what you're getting into before you sign on as a contributor? Get a PDF copy of the critic & pros praised Omen #1 Script by creator/writer Michael Nunneley sent immediately via email - no waiting for this perk!
$5 DIGITAL PACKAGE - A digital copy of Omen #1 upon completion, & 2 B&W character art piece (valued at $28) by Marco Cantillana.
$10 FULL COLOR, SIGNED CHARACTER ART - A full color Frank Wade aka Omen character piece signed by artist Marco Cantillana emailed to you (valued at $35)!
$15 STEP BY STEP PACKAGE A full page Step By Step (1 Pencil Page, 1 Inks Page, 1 Colors Page) process of Omen #1, Page 1 by the phenomenal Chile artist Marco Cantillana & the cover of Omen #1 by the Latvian artist Roalands Kalnins!! - sent digitally via email (valued at $60/$90).
$25 FULL CONTRIBUTOR PACKAGE - The critically & professionally praised Omen #1 script signed by creator/writer Michael Nunneley via mail, A digital copy of Omen #1 upon completion & 1 Full Color character art piece (valued at $37) from artist/colorist/letterer Marco Cantillana.
$35 EVERY BOOK IN PHASE ONE - A digital subscription to every title in Phase One of the Omenverse (Valued at $105).
$40 EXTRAS PACKAGE SIGNED COPIES - Signed, full-color cover & Frank Wade aka Omen character art by Marco Cantillana & Rolands Kalnins, Signed Omen #1 script, by M. Nunneley (creator/writer), Marco Cantillana (artist/colorist/letterer) & Rolands Kalnins (cover/logo design), Frank Wade/Omen character bio, 2 signed B&W character pieces by Marco Cantillana.
$50 ULTIMATE CONTRIBUTOR PACKAGE - A critically & professionally praised & signed Omen #1 script by creator/writer Michael Nunneley, A digital copy of Omen #1 upon completion, 1 full color Frank Wade aka Omen character art signed by artist/colorist/letterer Marco Cantillana, Step By Step Pages of Omen #1 Page 1 showing the pencils, inks & colors by Marco Cantillana, a Step By Step Cover Pages by Latvian artist Rolands Kalnins. A Character Profile of Frank Wade aka Omen, with secrets not revealed in the comics!
$75 OMEN MEGA-FAN PACKAGE - Signed Omen #1 script, Frank Wade aka Omen character art (B&W & Full Color) & cover pages - by Nunneley, Cantillana & Kalnins. step be step pages (Cantillana), character bio: Frank Wade aka Omen, & a digital subscription to all of Omen Comics titles in phase 1 (35 Issues).


The Impact
First of all, THANK YOU very much for taking the time to look at our page. Omen #1 is the first of 5 titles within the shared multiverse called Omenverse. Several pros & amateurs alike have both reviewed and praised the script for Omen #1. The most common response has been, "That was awesome! A well planned story." By contributing you are fulfilling the lifelong dreams of myself and my team - 1 of which, the artist/colorist/letterer, will make his American debut with this title (From Chile: Marco Cantillana "Hex 666" writer/artist). Not to mention getting some great characters as well as an original and entertaining story out into the indie world.


Risks & Challenges
The first hurdle in creating the Omenverse comics is paying artist/colorist/letterer Marco Cantillana for production of Omen #1 - which has already started (Marco is drawing/coloring/lettering the script RIGHT NOW! & the Cover & logo are completed).
The next hurdle has already been conquered: getting digital platforms to sell my comics - I have arranged to sell them on Amazon, Comixology & Comichause & we will have our own web comic page as well on ComicFury.
A bit about my journey here: I have wanted to make comics since I was 12 years old (1988) and I have been developing my writing and production skills through the decades including majoring in Creative Writing in college, creating comic stories and characters and even writing a fantasy novel - which has become a world in the Omen Comics multiverse. I have pursued this vocation my whole life and I have no intention of ever stopping until I am dead. I want nothing more than to write & create comics.


Other Ways You Can HelpHey, times are rough for everyone these days & I fully understand not having the funds to contribute. But there are still ways you can help that will make a big difference. #1:  Get the word out on social media and make some noise about the campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Save Our Souls is that stunning magazine that you’ve been waiting for. Featuring seriously great writing, comics and illustrations by brilliant writers, journalists and artists. You have to check it out!

Some of the glowing reviews for SOS mag #1 & #2:

"Excellent!" - Ian Rankin

"Definitely worth a look" - The Quietus

"stunningly impressive" -  disclaimermag.com

"to be commended for striving to do something new and interesting" -  forbiddenplanet.co.uk

"Pretty impressive if I do say" - David Graeber

The Save Our Souls manifesto...

 To be a place that promotes and encourages high quality work while being informative and fun.

To help fight the 'work for free and exposure' culture that is infecting the creative fields.

To work hard to be a publication that is unique, groundbreaking and 'must own'.

Photo: Issue #2

To meet our goals we...

We hand-pick and invite our writers and creators fresh from the farm to make sure this will be like nothing produced in the UK before.

Includes articles and reports on wide ranging topics and experiences by some of the best writers currently being published in major newspapers, magazines and websites.

We crowdfund each issue.

Photo: Issue #1

The funds we raise to publish Save Our Souls goes to...

High quality printing that does justice to the very lovely artwork and design.

So that the first 15 pages of the magazine doesn't have to be full of watch and perfume adverts.

We can pay the contributors for their work! The more crowdfunding we raise the more we can pay the creators so please support us all and spread the word!

story:
Hard to Swallow: The Collection

Hey Indiegogo! We are putting together a complete collection of Dave Davenport and Justin Hall's Hard to Swallow series, and we need your help!

About the Series

The Hard to Swallow anthology series was launched with a simple premise: that erotic comics should be great stories as well as being sexy. The series ran from 2006 to 2009 and featured everything from werewolves and skater ghosts to pirates and porn stars.

The authors drew inspiration from punk, tattoo art, indie comics, gei manga, and confessional memoir to create a strong new voice in gay erotica. They brought in guest cartoonists with each issue—BiL Sherman, Drub, Steve MacIsaac, and Brad Rader—who created their own idiosyncratic erotic tales.

Gay erotic comics were a staple in the early queer underground comics scene. They presented sex and sexuality frankly, boldly, delighting in their lasciviousness and inappropriateness for convenience-store spinner racks. These comics, designed to titillate, also became a way for gay artists to find and work with each other, and celebrate the sides of themselves that society wanted kept under the covers.

Now, Northwest Press is aiming to collect the entirety of the original, out-of-print series (plus almost 50 pages of new material!) into one gorgeous book. In the new tales, Dave catches up with the sexy monsters from "Gigantic", his first ever porn comics tale, while Justin delves deeper into his trove of autobiographical sex stories. New guests Victor Hodge and Jon Macy join them with their own remarkable works of sex fantasy.

Hard to Swallow is gay erotic comics made to be edgy, powerful, and personal (as well as smoking hot!). The series transcends smut into art, infusing its stories with wit, longing, and pointed commentary. It skips the stern-faced sex gods and delivers something more full of life, humor, and humanity. Hard to Swallow has inspired readers and cartoonists for 10 years, and now is finally being collected in the format it deserves.

The Rewards

We're offering a bunch of great rewards, centering around—of course—a copy of the Hard to Swallow collection, in digital and print formats. We've got packages for retailers as well, so they can be among the first to carry the book in their stores.

For those of you who want something a little special, we've got an edition of the book signed by Justin and Dave, including a limited edition full-color bookplate tucked inside, and you'll be thanked in the book!

Our Goal

Our Kickstarter campaign was successful, but we're seeking $2,000 more to defray additional costs. The printing turned out to be a bit more expensive than we were planning, so we're turning to Indiegogo to give readers a chance to pick up the paperback or hardcover of HARD TO SWALLOW or the special signed edition at a discount!

Thank you so much for your support of this project! We're excited to get it into your hands.

story: A few of us think it would be nice to surprise Blake on his big party day as he is going to sooooo much effort for us. What should we do...magic tricks, fireworks, an impersonator.......no something just a little bit more Blake.....something a bit carnival, a bit burlesque....in short a bit over the top.....hmmm how about...a scantily clad burlesque lady jumping out of an enormous cake and then serenading him (currently thinking "I'm too sexy is appropriate!" but very open to suggestions) Something we have all heard about but never actually seen (well at least we haven't). So much better than just a birthday cake..but a little bit expensive so we need some help (big or small)......

story:
What’s our project?

To take a rough draft story that is over 235,000 words long, polish it, and transform it into a webcomic.

The comic follows protagonist Zayg, a member of an alien race bent on universal conquest. When Zayg is discovered and taken into custody by the US Government, he is granted an unusual second chance when they place him with a human family. A chance to integrate into human society and prove he is not a danger. With the threat of being turned over to Midnight’s Cradle—an infamous alien research facility—hanging over his head, Zayg must watch his every move, and keep the Other in his mind as quiet as possible.


Who are we?

We are HanaChild. Hana is the artist, Child is the writer. Child came up with the original storyline, and Hana contacted her about the possibility of doing a webcomic. Both have been working to give the original story a more detailed and intriguing mythos, together developing a whole culture for the alien species.

Where is it/will it be?

Once funded, we will begin work immediately. The plan is, the posts will go:

  1. First to Patreon, where our patrons there will get to see the comic pages 2-3 days earlier
  2. Second to Inkblazers, released a page at a time to the general public

We aim for one page a week.

Why this project?

This project is already mostly set. The rough draft has been written, and only needs refining and artistry to bring it to full realization.

What do we need?

The base comic will be traditionally hand-drawn with computer edits, and we already have a tablet, so current needs are as follows:

  • Used Laptop: Est $550
  • Manga Studio: Est $30
  • Misc Physical art supplies: Est $200

IF WE DO NOT MEET OUR GOAL we will hold the amount collected and attempt to fund it piecemeal ourselves and/or attempt a second Indiegogo campaign. If we do not meet our goal, comic launch will be delayed.

WHAT’S THIS RIGHT HERE?

The never-before-seen prologue to the Resilience Saga.

  He came to himself, confused and disoriented as usual, but something was different this time. His arms stretched out to either side, held in place by taut chains, his ankles locked so close together he could barely keep his balance. His tail swung free, but the end had been wrapped tightly in metallic mesh. His head bowed and posture stooped, as if he’d been standing this way for days. His wrists ached, dried blood on his sleeves. Had he been struggling?

  Exhaustion burned in every cell, and he could feel bruising as he weaved slightly. A disembodied voice droned a question.

  “Are you machine, or organic?” It was dull, and disinterested, as if it had asked a hundred times before.

  His ears twitched slightly, as he croaked, “Organic.”

  There was a brief pause, a whisper of, “It’s talking,” and a scuffling sound. “Your back is made of metal and machinery.” The voice had come alive again with interest. “What about that?”

  “We’re all inset with our Bymai at hatching.” He winced. That was too much information. He longed for a chair or a stool, something to sit on. How long had he been standing? How long had they been asking him questions? It must have happened again. Had it been the shock of being captured?

  “What does it do?”

  “I can’t tell you that.” He snapped, eyes narrow. Who knew what they would use against him?

  “If you don’t tell us or give us a method of controlling whatever may come out of it,” the voice warned, “We’ll have to go in blind and figure it out ourselves.”

  That was not an option. Gritting his teeth, he growled, “It contains weaponry, medical abilities, tools, and life support. Now you answer me. Who are you? Where am I?”

  “Your name?” The question came back as if he hadn’t spoken.

  “Who are you?” He had been chained to face a wall with a darkly tinted mirror. He could see five pulsing red forms through the mirror with his sekset eyes, even as his pryset eyes took in his own battered reflection.

  “Your name.” The voice insisted.

  “Not until I am answered!” He roared. Instantly electricity jolted through the chains. His tail lashed as his feet raked claws across the concrete.

  “Your name.” The voice stated once more.

  “Zayg.” He gasped, hanging from the chains limply.

  “Well, Zayg, you are currently in the custody of the United States Government. It’s fortunate you came around, tomorrow is your trial.”

  “Trial?” His visions swam, blurring his reflected image with red pulsing figures.

  “Yes. You’re obviously not from this planet, so you are either a refugee, a scout, or a hostile, and as you have been rather uncooperative up until now, it’s not looking good for you. There’s still time, so I suggest you cooperate. We may be able to place you in a better situation than the one currently being considered.”

  “What’s that?”

  “Midnight’s Cradle.”

  Zayg sucked in a breath, fragments of Zee’s taunts in his head about the organization and the knives and scalpels they kept sharp just for freaks like him. The tiny cages. The cruel experiments.

  “I see you’ve heard of it. Ezequiel Florez is more than a little delighted to be proven right for once.”

  Zayg’s ears flattened against his skull. He could feel his Seilun pulse with fear. He could not go to that place. You owe the Agarvo nothing, the Other whispered in his mind. They abandoned you.

  I failed the mission. I face the consequences.

  To the death? They aren’t here. Nobody’s going to save you. Save yourself, they will never know. It will be decades before another is sent to take this world. There was a pause, and the Other continued. You know we want to live.

  Shutting all his eyes, he dragged the question out of himself. “What do you want to know?”

story:
Nemesis Studios has published our first book!!
"The Man With No Horse"
Follow the tale of the Wanderer as he makes his way through time bringing balance where there once was none. Ages of man will succumb to his will and find themselves face to face with fate's messenger. In this first chapter of five, the Wanderer squares off against an old west crime boss and his minions to save the life of a farmer's daughter and to bring balance to this lawless town.
Full color covers both inside and out, black and white interiors and 24 total pages
We are running a campaign to raise the funds to help our distribution and to help offset the cost of our promotional tour for 2015.  The funds raised will also help to print our second book slated to be at press by mid 2015. The remainder of the pledged funds will go to the Artist we have secured for the following Book "Single Family Home" . 
We as creators and fans know that $4000 is a bit much to hope for but it truly sets the stage for a pair of books to be printed and distributed.  The Artists and writers to be paid a fair page rate, all of them. We at Nemesis Studios always end up eating the publishing costs in the end but we strive to showcase Creator/ Owners in a way not done in the past. When you consider the second book is almost at press and the third is in scripting, we aren't doing to shabby thu far. We promise 100% FULFILLMENT on all perks on or before the due date described.
 Thanks again as always we appreciate your support.
Stan Konopka
Creator Owner
Nemesis Studios 2015

story:
So here’s the story. I am an actress who loves action. Spartacus is my favorite show, hockey is my favorite sport, is it any wonder that comics is where I choose to devote my energy?  I originally started out  campaigning  for Wonder Woman then Gal Godot swooped in and hijacked that!  Well well I thought I’ll just redirect…..Wonder Woman’s archnemesis, CHEETAH! BOOM now I can take her down its perfect!  I saw some Sizzle Reels courtesy of YouTube and BAM now I got plan! (Oh, for those of you who don’t know, because I didn’t … a sizzle reel is simply a trailer for a movie I imagine myself cast in) Ok this seems pretty ambitious right? It’s not. My job is to create, my job is take the next right action and let go of the results. ACTION ACTION ACTION.

That being said, I was taught by some pretty incredible mentors to live in the space of my hearts desire.  I figured since I want to play some pretty tough chics…I better learn how to be a pretty tough chic. That meant I had to intensify everything: my diet, my workout.  I came upon Chris Moran at JKD NYC . This wasn’t too difficult to find since his school is named one of the top 5 Martial Arts schools in NYC.  AMAZING!!  Naturally, I started training . I trained everyday because my intention was to get good fast; casting is in session!!!! Well Chris said “I need to slow my roll here”… ok got it. So, I was patient and I trained, and eventually I started getting pretty good. 

Now it was time to start Sizzle Reel action plan!  My dear friend Josh wrote a script. Chris Moran did the entire choreography. I had a costume made by another talented friend, so this is great! off to a good start!  Several months, and thousands of dollars later, this baby was looking good! Got the SWAT guys (the JKD staff) who trained and worked endlessly with me, costume fittings galore, and practice makeup sessions so this can be the best it can be.  I got my camera crew ready, and, not only is their work amazing, they are professional stuntmen!

Now for the really fun part! We film on a rooftop, in New York City, JKD’S to be exact; its an incredible location. We use the fire escape for a knife sequence and inside the studio for some interaction with Cheetah and the Joker!

16 hours later we finished.  I had cuts, scrapes, bruises, I was bleeding, cold and tired. Fight sequences are no joke and I’d do it all again in a heartbeat. To feel that joy of doing what I love and being surrounded by supportive like-minded people was a gift and something I think every person should be able to experience.

This project is a milestone for me. For awhile it felt as though I’m a bartender who wants to act, now because of this experience, I’m an actress who has to tend bar. I moved into a new space with this project.  It’s a tool that is only going to help further my career ambitions.  Everything so far has been paid out of pocket.While we have finished filming, it is still incomplete due to editing.  But, this is where you come in. I need some help. I have a stubborn streak of “I can do this on my own” lets get real here I did none of this on my own! If it wasn’t for this amazing group of people I have had the good fortune to work with, this project would never have seen the light. 

The money donated will go towards the camera crew, equipment and editing, the costumes, hair and makeup, and oh yeah the COSTUMES!  It seems a small list here but trust me it is no easy fete. A portion of the proceeds will go towards Imagine there is no Hunger. A campaign that supports ending hunger around the world. I have been helped and this is my way of paying it forward. 

Most of the perks you see have been donated by generous friends and coworkers who want to show their support. I got some pretty great giveaways!

Thank you Kindly

story:
ABSOLUTE UNIVERSE #1's

Along came a spider, and changed everything!

WHITE WIDOW is the recent new #1 comic and through the support of many, has been very well received.  However, it's just the start of an inter-connected, shared universe line of comics from ABSOLUTE COMICS GROUP.

We wanted to launch this campaign to give those who may have missed the exclusive WHITE WIDOW #1 issues a chance to get in on the ground floor, as well as introduce everyone to 8 other titles that are coming out that connect to the line as a whole!

First, let's take a look at the 9 titles that we are launching with:

What We Need

These books are already at the printer, and so the funding from this campaign will be used to help with some of the shipping costs, as well as help us to continue moving the line forward by paying for creative and development costs. 

As you can see, we use top-tier artists and creators to make some amazing comics!  But we need your help to continue moving ahead.  You're literally helping us build and maintain an entire universe.  That's a lot of power in your hands... and as they say with great power...

What You Get

In an effort to try to make this as simple as possible, we've broken the comics into a variety of "Tier Groups."  The covers you see in each group will correspond to the PERK LEVELS from your pledge. 

The next section are separated out because it is worth explaining that these are SKETCH covers.  The two New York Comic-Con Preview #1 issues will be available in the NYCC Tiers.

The rest of these items (specifically Art Prints) will be available as ADD-ONs through our BACKER KIT once the campaign has ended only.

The Score

It's important to note that while White Widow was ordered well by retailers, the numbers for the other books did not fare as well in the comic shops...  So, unless you pre-ordered these titles, this may be the only way for you to receive them.

Also it pays to remember that we already ordered the printing of these books, so quantities are extremely limited... especially on the higher tier covers.  We firmly believe that with the success of White Widow, and how intricately connected she is to these titles... they will fast become collectors issues.  This may be your absolute best way to get in on the ground floor!

Risks & Challenges

These books are already printing and are awaiting shipping.  That's where you come in.

Other Ways You Can Help

We really hope you will help support us, and truly appreciate any help in spreading the word!  We really need you to help continue growing the Absolute Universe.  The future is in your hands.

story:
Welcome...

Hello and thank you for taking the time to visit the Zyklon B comic book series funding page. Zyklon B is a comic book miniseries broken down into four parts. Each issue is 22 full color pages of gore, violence and bad language. This is for a mature audience only and harks back to the days of 80's video nasties and a stlye of art that has been lost in recent times.

This series has been in the works for over a year now and the team involved have been working super hard to bring you folks something really special. As a backer of this project you get to be involved on the ground level and have the chance to earn yourself some great rewards and to see content before ANYONE else.

Issue one...

Just so you know, issue one is being worked on right now and is nearing completion. This means that we are able to offer the rewards to you with the promise that you will recieve your chosen perk by July.

“They arrested Him ...  they executed him ...and now ... Simon Fisher is PI**ED OFF!”

In 1988 Simon Fisher gets sent to San Quentin Prison for a crime he did not commit. Inside the inhospitable walls Simon strikes up an unlikely friendship with a fellow inmate called Caleb Fontana. While incarcerated, Simon learns the power of the Dark Arts from Caleb. When Caleb is in danger, Simon intervenes and is forced to kill another inmate and ends up on death row. When they try and execute Simon he becomes their worst nightmare! Follow Simon on his quest for revenge and his search for a return to humanity!

Meet the creative team...

Adam B. Cheal. The writer and creator of the “Zyklon B” comic book series.

Joel J. Cotejar is the series artist and is an established freelance illustrator and comic book artist.

Mike Summers is the series colorist and has worked on the following published comics: Outlaws #0, Tales of the supernatural, Barbarian Series 1-4, Red Angel Series 1-4 & ICCW Rampage.

Mindy Lopkin is the series letterer and has worked on the following comics: Iconic 2, Sky Pirates of Valendor, Worst Case Scenario: Outbreak anthology and in house work for Pronto Comics.

The Story...

Simon Fisher is executed in the gas chamber at San Quentin prison. Using the power of the occult his physical form is transformed into deadly hydrogen cyanide, AKA “Zyklon B”. Simon, now known as “Visher” embarks upon a quest of revenge on those he deems responsible for his death. Special FBI Agent “Jack Storm” enlists the help of Simon’s former cell mate and mentor “Caleb Fontana” to help track him down. Caleb has a hidden agenda of his own and betrays Jack Storm resulting in his death. Through the power of a gemstone obtained from an ancient demon, Jack Storms body is reanimated. The tables turn as Jack is now the one seeking vengeance and will stop at nothing to get it. This is a tale of revenge and redemption for both good and evil.

Why we need the money...

The money that we need is to help pay our starving artists and to pay for production and printing costs. Every penny we recieve will go into making each and every issue a thing of beauty. Over $3000 dollars of our own money has already gone into creating this sereis and we just need a little help to complete the sereis and bring issue one into print. I would like to add that as the writer and creator of this series, not one penny will end up going into my pocket. Every contribution will be reinvested in the project :)

Now the good bit...

What you will receive if you back us. We know that you work hard for your money, so we want to offer rewards that not just worth the money, but EXCLUSIVE to this funding project. Think of how good it will feel to rub it in peoples noses when you show them your limited edition signed copy of only 100 or to strut your stuff in that Zyklon B Comic book T-Shirt. (Take a look in the gallery to see the design). There are also some cool character designs there and you can see some art from the book.

Check out the section on the right hand side to see the great rewards we have on offer. If you have chosen a perk with signed prints, please confirm which signed prints you require by using the card numbers from the images in the gallery.

Even of you can't contribute but want to help, spread the word to all your friends (and enemies). Join us on twitter or facebook to show your support.

Thank you so much for dropping by and an even bigger thanks if you made a contribution :) 

 

PLEASE USE PAYPAL ONLY :)

story:
THE BACKSTORY

Hi this is Dan Nokes of 21st Century Sandshark Studios!  Back in 2011 I put out volume 1 of ADAM AND EVE: BIZARRE LOVE TRIANGLE IN THE ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE!  Basically a simple and oft told tale of a boy, his talking scooter, and gene spliced dog, looking for the woman of his dreams, while being unknowingly stalked by his zombie ex girlfriend!

Ive spent the last year or so traveling the country trying to promote the hell out of this little creative endeavor, and winning some converts along the way!  Now we have arrived to the portion of this little endurance trial where I attempt to birth the second and final volume of Adam and Eve entitled THE DEAD SHUFFLE, THE PASTOR PREACHES AT MIDNIGHT, AND THE STORES ARE ALWAYS OPENED: A TRAVELOGUE TO ROMANCE!  

HOW YOU CAN BE PART

Simple!

1) Invest at any dollar amount you feel comfortable with!  Some cool awards will be bestowed upon those who invest generously!

2) Spread the word of this little eneavor through word of mouth or webernet transmission!

3) Some combination of 1 and 2

STILL NOT CONVINCED???

How about some of these critical type quips about volume 1 to help you make a decision...

"The artwork reminds me somewhat or the old cartoons that used to be on MTV late night television, which I really like.  The art style with the brilliant mix of brutal and comedic genius writing works perfectly." 

Paul Cheeze Good

CRAZY MAN RAMBLINGS

 

"Its like the Walking Dead...But with humor"

Ric The Real Stooge

THIS WEEK IN BULLSHIT

 

"Awesome read"

Nick Davis

ALT WORLD

 

"Its funny, its tounge-in-cheek, and its very smart!"

Harry Cee

THE NEXT ISSUE


 "It’s just as cool as it sounds."

Denise Dutton

ATOMIC POPCORN

"

Do not kill the dog!"

Don Smith

THE JACKYL'S HEAD


"One of the books I read in 2011...:

Chuck "Dash" Parker

CHUCKDASHPARKER.COM


YOU MEAN YOU STILL ARE NOT CONVINCED!!!

Well how about an 14 page preview to get your appetite rolling!

http://issuu.com/21sandshark/docs/adam_and_eve_preview_2

MORE QUESTIONS, QUERIES, STRANGE CRAVINGS FOR THE UNKNOWN???

Please feel free to contact me at sandshark@comcast.net or go to www.21sandshark.com for more info!

Thank you one and all and LETS MAKE THIS HAPPEN!!!

DAN NOKES

CREATIVE DIRECTOR

21st CENTURY SANDSHARK STUDIOS

story:
Black and White is Back!

The line between justice and vengeance is blurred when an ex spy and a brewery heiress join forces to take down an extremist with a growing army of robots 

 

I'm Art Thibert, and back in 1994 while working at Extreme Studios, I was given the opportunity to publish my very first independent comic through Image.  My wife, Pamela, and I wrote Black & White as a three-issue mini-series which sold over 500,000 copies.  Since then, readers have constantly asked me when this duo would make their triumphant return to print.  

Black and White - Remastered is the original story which has been re-crafted with new updated story, additional pages, remastered artwork and colors.  My  new co-writer, Taylor Grosso, and I have updated the storyline and script. My wife, Pamela, is on board as Editor-in-Chief; together we have brought this project into the 21st century.

With the help of  you, the Indiegogo backers, Black and White will be given new life and a chance to return to the reader's hands as a two part epic adventure.  The readers have spoken, and we have listened!  Because I'm taking a step out of the mainstream industry, I hope you will support the Black and White team with the first of many independent projects we have planned for you.

 

OODLES OF DOODLES AND OTHER STUFF TOO-  AVAILABLE NOW

A 52 page 8.5'" x 12"  large size hardcover art book collecting 35 years of comic book artwork by Art Thibert. 

Oodles of Doodles and Other Stuff Too is a collection of DC and Marvel published work, covers, commissions, sketches and never before seen project pitches and future concepts. This is a deluxe collectors book with a dust jacket, spot UV effects on the cover and high gloss pages, plus a forward by the legendary Kevin Nowlan. 

This book is limited to 200 copies, and all are signed and numbered.  Get in early, these books will sell out quickly. 

These books are printed and ready to ship now. (Excluding the Black and White book bundle)

_______________________________STRETCH GOALS____________________________________ 

 

15K STRETCH GOAL -UNLOCKED Get Pamela Thibert's (The original series writer) Signature on all Graphic Novels! 

18K STRETCH GOAL - UNLOCKED  Bookmark!

Bookmark 

20K STRETCH GOAL - UNLOCKED Upgrade Black and White Remastered to a square-bound printed book

22K STRETCH GOAL - UNLOCKED "Stick it to the Bots!" Sticker added 

Sticker

25K STRETCH GOAL - UNLOCKED Black and White Miniprint  of cover 

Mini print 

30K STRETCH GOAL - UNLOCKED Extend Black and White Remastered  with new never before seen story pages.

32K STRETCH GOAL- UNLOCKED Limited edition Black and White  2019 Calendar 

Calendar

35K STRETCH GOAL -  UNLOCKED  Original Art Giveaway! One lucky backer will win an original Black and White sketch by Art Thibert

37K STRETCH GOAL - UNLOCKED  Exclusive Black and White embroidered patch 

 

Patch

40K STRETCH GOAL - UNLOCKED Exclusive Black and White Trading card

46K STRETCH GOAL -UNLOCKED Black and White  Collectors Button set (3)

Button set

50K STRETCH GOAL - UNLOCKED   Bonus for our colorist, the amazing  Periya

51K STRETCH GOAL - UNLOCKED  M1-10 Anti Robotics Task force  official Patch! 

**NOTE **STRETCH GOALS ARE FOR  BACKERS OF  THE BLACK AND WHITE  PHYSICAL BOOK TIERS ONLY ---PDF tiers not included in stretch goals.

This book is limited to 200 copies, and all are signed and numbered.  Get in early, these books will sell out quickly. 
These books are printed and ready to ship now. (Excluding the Black and White book bundle)

story:
Short Summary

Ghost Stories is the story of few college freshman who take a dose bigger than they can handle when a girl they invite over to roll ecstasy with is candy flipping without letting them know. When she starts to lose her mind they follow her down a frightening time warped rabbit hole. Watch as they try to keep their heads as she loses hers.
 
I have been blessed with an amazing cast and crew who are dedicated to making this dream a reality.  I have been in pre-production for a year now making this script the best it can be.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Equipment
    • In order to attain the Style of the film we plan on shooting on the RED Scarlet camera with Cooke Prime lenses.  Along with the addition of specific lighting packages such as the Kino Divas and Kino Celebs, this will give us the freedom we need in post for visual effects and the freedom on set to move quickly and make our days.
  • Catering
    • I personally have been on a few unfortunate sets where the cast and crew were left working long hours with insufficient food and drink.  This is unacceptable, and I do not want to put my crew through the same ordeal thus having good catering is essential.
  • Transportation
    • In order to make our days and move sufficiently we will need proper transportation from locations for cast, crew and equipment.   
  • Props
    • This story calls for very specific and taboo props.  There will NOT be any narcotics on this set.  The props will be crafted by our set prop master who will create these faux drugs specifically for this film.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some other ways you will be able to help make Ghost Stories come to life are as simple as supporting us on Facebook and making it known to the community.  Follow our work and progress on Facebook at www.facebook.com/ghoststoriesthemovie. Let it be known.
