story:
Sometimes Dead is Better...

When Otis resorts to making moonshine, he makes a grave mistake that costs him his life. Seeing Otis’ lifeless body, the now widowed Mary tries to bring him back using ancient magic. But not everything is as it seems, and dark forces gather in the shadows. Love, sadness, death and the macabre await you within the pages of Otis Stein!

  • Full color cover front and back with B&W story interiors by Carlos F. Rodriguez make up this 36 page book.
  • The book is 100% complete and ready for print.
  • Written and created by indie writer, Matthew Vealey with art by Carlos F. Rodriguez, this book isn’t like anything you’ve seen on the indie comics market. 

This book is loosely based on a flash fiction feature Matthew wrote within the pages of Ashcan Comics Publishing’s Old School Monsters. He has always had a deep love and an appreciation for all horror. Otis Stein is his love letter to the genre. From subtle references in every page to horror classics of the past, to new ideas he brings alongside them, this book is sure to be one hell of a ride for those looking for a unique and bloodcurdling experience.

With the talent of Carlos F. Rodriguez on Pencils, Inks and Colors, this is sure to be an eye catching book. Carlos is a talented graphic artist with dreams of working in comics. His contoured art style really complements the tone and atmosphere for the story. With artwork that takes a life of it's own and seems to flow over the page, creating something truly unique. Otis is the love child of passion and teamwork from both writing and art.

What We Need & What You Get

The book is complete, but we need your help to get it to print!

  • We need roughly $500 to print this book.
  • We are also offering an 18”x24” poster printed with black light reactive ink shipped in a tube mailer at additional costs. This is definitely an eye catcher and a great decoration.
  • Full color art print of the original illustration of Otis by Bruce Patnaude.
  • 1.5" hard enamel pin of the Otis Stein logo. Very cool and snazzy.
  • Own a page from the book by Carlos F. Rodriguez (Limit of 24)

 Our Goal

By supporting this book, you are helping two indie creators make their dreams a reality and we hope to bring you much more of Otis with your help. Here are a few things your support will help us accomplish:

  • Create more great stories with Otis, including epic crossovers with fellow indie creators.
  • Provide politics free entertainment, no soapboxes or propaganda here. The drapes here are just blue and that’s the way we like it.
  • Rise up to offer solid entertainment in a waning industry that has lost focus on what really matters: entertainment and escapism.
  • Build and establish our own comic universe, filled to the brim with new characters and stories to tell. Now's the best time to get in on the ground floor.

No Risk & Only One Challenge

We wouldn't ask for you to invest in us unless we have done it ourselves. We've already poured our time and resources into making this book a reality, but now we need your support to take it further.

  • The book is complete, we just need your help covering print costs as well as try to make our own investment back in this project.
  • No waiting years for the book you helped make happen. As soon as the check clears, the print files will be sent and we start fulfillment.
  • Matthew has worked on many other titles as a writer, editor and letterer. He's published numerous stories that have already seen release. From free eZine contributions like Ralph vs. Kung-Flu in Corona Kings to the Banjoman Ashcan included with Legends of the Lone Wolf. When he aims to do something, it gets done. No excuses! He only provides results here, folks.

  Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help or possibly get a copy:

  • Share and get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.  Every voice added helps boost the signal!
  • Use the Indiegogo share options so we can track your referrals. The top five people with the most referrals will win free stuff.
  •  So even if you can’t support monetarily, you can still get the book by helping us promote. Every little bit of help matters. 

  Win Free Stuff Just by Sharing

The five people with the most referrals will earn free stuff along with their name in the book as thanks. We need all the help we can get so we plan on rewarding those five for their efforts. Be sure to use the sharing tools while logged into IndieGoGo so we can better track your referrals. Sadly, this does exclude international backers unless you agree to cover the shipping costs.

 
  • 1st Place will receive Otis Stein #1 pdf and physical, as well as the black light poster and an original page from the book!
  • 2nd Place will receive Otis Stein #1 pdf and physical along with the 18"×24" black light poster.
  • 3rd Place will receive Otis Stein #1 pdf and physical.
  • 4th and 5th Place will receive Otis Stein #1 pdf

 International Orders

Due to the high and varied cost of shipping international, we cannot directly offer this option. Not just because of costs, but a lot of books tend to get extremely damaged or disappear from existence all together. If you still insist, you can contact us directly and we can try to work something out. Do note we are not responsible for lost or damaged items on international orders.

story:
The Otakus’ Dream

Who are we?

We are Cinematography students from Ecuador. Our team consists on students from the following departments: Acting, Directing, Photography and Animation.

What is our first story about?

Genesis: The realm of the abyss, is the story about Tadeo, a teen boy, who possesses mysterious powers, and is constantly looking for answers to his existence, within religious tales and prophecies. Because of his curiosity he will uncover the truth of his powers, and he will find more people like him.

What is the focus of our project?

We seek to partake in the creation of Mangas, and to participate on international Contests that will take place in Japan later this year. We want to succeed in order to create a new business model in our home country, Ecuador.

Do we believe we can be in Shonen Jump?

We believe so, we have faith in our product and we know this is a unique opportunity. We are confident that with your support, we can make this dream of ours a reality.

What is this Campaign’s objective and what will we be investing on?

The purpose of this campaign is to, first on foremost generate an income. This income will help us with the following expenses:

-Our Staff’s commission.

-Tools for the products’ digitalization.

-Tools for the physical copies of the products

-Camera equipment to help us on making even more videos and keep you updated on our progress.

-Legal and financial aspects.

-An administrative office/work space for ease of production and meetings.

Other ways to support us?

One of the main way in which you can help is to share this campaign via your social media. You can also help by showing it to friends and family members who might be interested on this project.

If you have any inquiries or comments please use the following contact information:

+593-0999845293

+593-0987939465

joacsvald@gmail.com

mouchejoseph@gmail.com

Rewards, terms and conditions.

We have stablished some rewards as a thank you for your help. We have a variety of rewards and we hope you can enjoy them.

The rewards will be sent via FedEx.

For the delivery of the rewards, it'll be able if we exceed the 80% of the firs amount

story:
Why Me? Oh Woe. (Who am I and Why am I here?)

Once upon a time, I graduated college despite homelessness and giant squids drowning innocent ships in China. With my new bachelor's degree in anthropology, I got a job as a bill collector in a 99% turn around environment. 90 days later I returned to my life as a comic guru through a webcomic called Akashik and a newly-formed team called the Writers of the Apocalypse. And I haven't looked back.

No, really. Why am I here?

10 Confessions & A Kiss follows one girl, Zoe, who gets into a bit of trouble when she "accidentally" gets cursed to find her one true love. She has 365 days to do so, or she dies. (Da da da dum!) 

Her obstacle is she was an awkward girl in high school, so she's never dated. Not once. She's spunky, but boy-shy. And she has no one she even likes, much less could feel love for. If you don't think this could bring trouble, think again. It's one thing to have made your mistakes in high school when the hormones are flying off the handle. When you're in college and have no social clue in the world? You don't even know where to begin!

This is meant to be a limited series with about 15 chapters, give or take. My goal is to keep the story down to three graphic novels, at any rate. Currently I am in the middle of producing chapter 2.

Meet the Main (and minor) characters:

Zoe: Our spunky, red-headed protagonist.  She can be brave and willing to stick her nose where it doesn't belong, but get her standing in front of a love interest and she's suddenly shy. It's her spunk that gets her into trouble in the first place. Well, that and the curse on the gypsy's bracelet laid there by the ill fate of the Princess Zomigod - but that's a while 'nother part of the story.

Alexi: Zoe's best friend and staunch supporter. He doesn't really believe in anything he can't see or touch, but the curse changes his mind. He'd be a love interest at the start of this except he's dating the mysterious Patches.  Or maybe he IS a love interest ...

Lala: A nod to my ethnic roots, Lala is a no-nonsense UFO-believing "Native American" and Zoe's other best friend. She makes it her personal mission to get Zoe a boyfriend.

Grigori: Grandson of the gypsy Madame Schlotsky, meet the second main love interest in the story. Zoe doesn't like him at first, but perhaps she will change her mind later.

It's The End Guy: He was meant to have only a cameo, but he wormed his way into the story. Because of his touch with Zoe and her life he ends up returning to school to attend graphic arts. He won't have a large role.

Madame Schlotsky and Madame Rue: gypsies. They tell the guys stuff.

And a host of other minor characters!

Which means I'm here because ...

Right now my goal with 10 is to assemble the first five chapters into a chapter book. Or, manga book if you prefer.  The first step in this is for me to revisit chapter 1, ink it, tone it, improve some of the artwork, and basically give it the polished feel I wanted it to have when I began this venture. Then I will return to chapter 2, on to chapter 3, and so on.

Each chapter will be available for Kindle and Nook by themselves. Chapter 1 is currently available this way, but I warn you: I'm revamping it and I will be changing things soon. I also might change my mind about this part and take them completely down, leaving only the chapter books available.

When all is said and done, I want to produce a limited print run of the each chapter book - maybe 500 or so - with a unique cover that will be only available through 10's website and at conventions.  All other editions gotten through WotA's distributor will have a different cover, etc. Kind of like the Darkwing Duck Comic-con only edition that I'd love to have for my very own. (sigh)

Ergo...

I Need...

In order of importance:

To be able to set aside funds for the print run.
Paper - lots and lots of manga artist paper with guidelines, A4 in size
Pens (Faber-Castel manga black: XS, S, M, B)
Prismacolor Markers (all of the cool grey shades)
Manga Studio Pro
Paintshop X3 - $70 at my local PX
Computer upgrades and/or replacement

 My goal of $500 is far FAR below what I truly need to see this dream happen. But it's a start.

What You Get

As a person of little financial worth (unless you count military life insurance) I don't have a lot to offer. But let me see...

I can offer wallpapers! Woo hoo! How's that for originality?
I can also offer a PDF of chapter 1, PDF's of the entire book when it's assembled, being drawn into the book, original art... yeah, okay. Just check out the pledges and rewards to the right.

Please consider extending your support. Anything you give is appreciated. If you cannot donate financially, please consider donating your time and sharing this project with another. 

If this campaign succeeds; besides the money to survive, I'll have the moral boost to make more comics - and another independent comic won't bite the dust like so many do.  And it would be neat if I could also consider hiring someone to create a free flash dress up game. Because I like stimulating the economy.

If this campaign doesn't succeed: C'est la vie... I'll be sad, but what are ya gonna do really.  If this happens I'll continue to fight my battle against the evil forces of the economy. And maybe I'll get to win.  Which would be great! Because there's this OTHER comic I'm dying to create called Hollywood Heroes ...

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!  Every time you do one of the following, I'll enter you into a raffle to get a free sketch commission from me. You can request anything... um... not x-rated.  :-)


E-mail me (deathATapocalypsewritersDOTcom) a blog post, LiveJournal entry, or DeviantART journal where you've posted this project.

Tweeted about this project.

Re-blog about this project on your Tumblr, Kaboodle, or any place like that.

Send me the physical goods I mentioned! Check out the donation page for Heavenly Bride at http://apocalypsewriters.com/ooakleaf/?page_id=755 then scroll down to see where to send. If you do I'll mail you back a bookmark. If you send me LOTS of goods, I'll mail you back a digital, signed print of Zoe and the bookmark.

Did something else? E-mail me (deathATapocalypsewritersDOTcom)!



10 Confessions used to be able to be found at: http://www.10confessions.com

please consider donating your time and sharing this project with another. If this campaign succeeds;

comics - and another independent comic won't bite the dust like so many do.  And it would be neat if I could also consider hiring someone to create a free flash dress up game. Because I like stimulating the economy.
If this campaign doesn't succeed: C'est la vie... I'll be sad, but what are ya gonna do really.  If this happens I'll continue to fight my battle against the evil forces of the economy. And maybe I'll get to win.  Which would be great! Because there's this OTHER comic I'm dying to create called Hollywood Heroes ... 

Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word!  Every time you do one of the following, I'll enter you into a raffle to get a free sketch commission from me. You can request anything... um... not x-rated.  :-)

E-mail me (deathATapocalypsewritersDOTcom) a blog post, LiveJournal entry, or DeviantART journal where you've posted this project.Tweeted about this project.Re-blog about this project on your Tumblr, Kaboodle, or any place like that.Send me the physical goods I mentioned! Check out the donation page for Heavenly Bride at http://apocalypsewriters.com/ooakleaf/?page_id=755 then scroll down to see where to send. If you do I'll mail you back a bookmark. If you send me LOTS of goods, I'll mail you back a digital, signed print of Zoe and the bookmark.Did something else? E-mail me (deathATapocalypsewritersDOTcom)!10 Confessions used to be able to be found at: http://www.10confessions.com

story:
Stretch Goal Tracker

 

What is all of this about?

Hello! Hej! Hola! (those are the only languages I can speak... so I'll stop there)

I'm Irma Eriksson of the comic "Imy" (find it here!) I've been creating "Imy" since November of 2007. Since that fateful first comic "just for fun," I've created over 470 strips, I've printed 2 mini-books, and 3 volumes. I've displayed at New York Comic Con for 3 years and Stockholm's Comic Festival for 4 years. It's been a great adventure and I have no plans to get off this ride just yet. And that means that the 4th Volume is on its way!

But I need your help.

That's where Indiegogo comes in.

With your help I can get "Imy" Vol 4.0 printed in time for NYCC this year, and maybe even make it possible for me to attend more cons in the future.

"Imy Vol. 4.0" will be printed in full, vibrant color, it will contain strips #301-#405, an extra exclusive story about what would happy if Imy went to Mars, and some more fun extras!

Those of you who want the book but won't be making it to NYCC can use this campaign as the perfect way to pre-order and guarantee that you'll get a copy. It's the best way to make sure you WILL have a copy of Volume 4 in your hands!

And whether or not you're interested in the book, there are some GREAT incentives that include digital versions of books 1-4, and original art and prints! 

Or, if you just want to help out, any donation is welcome and appreciated more than you'll know!

So...

Ready to contrubute? Here are the goodies you can choose from!

 

Streeeeetch goals!

If, by some chance, I actually make it to my goal way before deadline then we have the opportunity for stretch goals!

At $750 - The extra money will be put towards new promotional materials to be used at cons and everyone who chose an incentive with books will get a bookmark as well!

At $800 - Cafe Rawk coffee sleeves will be added to every book order!

At $1000 - The extra money will go towards my table at NYCC and the extra books I need to sell there!

At $1200 - Downloadable wallpapers of Imy on Mars for all who donated! Also, I can get some much needed art supplies for creating original art for the fans at the cons I go to.

At $2000 - Equipment upgrade! 

More stretch goals will be added if necessary!

When can you expect to get your stuff?

It's going to take time for me to get everything together and ready to send out. Plus I have a trip to NYCC taking up some time as well. So you can expect your stuff in December. Anything digital, like PDFs, will most likely come to you earlier. But plan on December for your merchandise.

Did you make it through all of this and realize you never read my comic?

That's fine! You can go to the site and read them all! Enjoy!

http://www.imycomic.com

story:
Bret Braddock Is An Arsehole

There's this webcomic I do. It's called Showman? The Bret Braddock Adventures, and it's about that guts-tearing feeling you get when you're being taken advantage of by a boss who hasn't paid you in two months, and who may never pay you at all.


It follows Bret Braddock, a delusional "media mogul" and owner of the Wariq Kapar's Kofta Palace restaurant chain, as he tries to bring to life an idiotic kids' show called The Magic Kofta. He hires loads of crew to make the show, including unusually competent production manager Sally Quince.




Bret's failure to grasp the industry he's plunging into turns an exciting challenge into an unending nightmare for Sally.


The Bret Braddock Adventures is kind of like a police procedural where a TV production gets murdered. Slowly.


It's about working in TV (and is based somewhat on "life experience" in the animation industry), but hopefully it's entertaining to anybody who's ever had a lousy boss or three.




Preorder Volume 2!

There's already been one book of Bret's adventures, which collected episodes 1-42. This second book completes the heartrending story, collecting episodes 43-96.


I'm hoping enough people want to order their copy of Volume 2 (and Volume 1, too, if they don't already have it) that I can get the $650 I need to print the book. If we don't quite make it to $650, I'll cover the rest myself. Either way, everybody gets their order.


Your Choices

1. I have Volume 1 and want to order Volume 2.

Ten dollars will take care of that. One hand-numbered copy of The Bret Braddock Adventures, Vol. 2, sent right to you before anybody else gets theirs.


2. I want both volumes 1 & 2.

Fifteen dollars is all that's required. The whole terrible saga, whacked into the post and ready for bathroom enjoyment in mere days.


3. I want everything I can get.

Then shoot me fifty dollars, greedyguts. You will receive:


  • The Bret Braddock Adventures Vol. 1.
  • The Bret Braddock Adventures Vol. 2.
  • A nice one-off giclee print of your preferred episode (any of 1 thru 76, as seen at docklandsentertainment.com).
  • A piece of hand-drawn Bret Braddock art on an authentic 350gsm non-archival cardboard beer mat.

Oh, and I'll list all of you pre-orderers in Vol. 2 so everybody who reads it will know what good taste you have.




Got No Money?

Then shoot this link to anybody you know who likes comics and has ten dollars!


And you'll be able to read the entire story at docklandsentertainment.com later in the year. Most of it is there already!



Thanks For Reading

story:
Once Upon a Frying Pan,

 Once Upon a Frying Pan, is the 72 page graphic novel by Brett Wood (The Silver Bullet, Devil Dealers). The Pan Man is sent to fast food Hell, forced to spend an eternity frying up burgers for rude customers… who are also food. It’s pretty trippy.

BUT! The Pan Man with a paper bag on his head gains a magic frying pan, frees himself, and goes on an odyssey not unlike Dante’s Inferno. You know, if Dante’s Inferno had more hamburgers, fries, evil bears that care, and guitar stealing angels.

Once Upon a Frying Pan’s story (first 40 pages) and all interior art  and covers drawn by Brett Wood. Script assists (issues 1-2) are by Ross May (Devil Dealers, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles) and Steve Willhite (writer of issue 3, cover and the colorist of the trade covers) Wil Brendel (cover colorist issue 1), William Grapes (letterer issue 1).

This book just got finished!

 

Its the Pan Man in Fast Food Hell and a battle of wits with El Diablo himself!

There is 0 risk! And all GAIN!

So go ahead and place an order then kick back and play some video games...

Comics Xtravaganza Perk! Includes Silver Bullet volume 1 and 2 and the Devil Dealers trade!

​Here's the skatedeck for the skatedeck perk. There's only 3 slots available.

Get the sketch perk and have Brett pick your favorite character to draw!

A Fighting Astronaut Production...

story:
Update!! T-shirt Designs:
 
 
 

I'm Matt Boatright-Simon, the writer and star of Sherlock Holmes' Smarter (Half) Brother.  A little over a decade ago I had the amazing privilege of co-creating and performing at the Edinburgh Fringe. The show was a smashing success, garnering numerous four star reviews, incredible sold-out audiences, the highest honors and awards, and multiple touring opportunities. The experience that changed my life. It expanded my mind and heart and made me want to share that experience with everyone I know.  The Edinburgh Fringe Festival  produces over 60,000 performances from great artists, actors, dancers, stand-up comedians from around the world is something to behold.

So that formative experience simmered in me for over a decade and then I had a revelation -- return to Edinburgh with an original and uproarious Sherlock Holmes Legacy play! "Sherlock Holmes' Smarter (Half) Brother" is a loving send up to the Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's beloved character.

It's a hilarious, brash, and edgy comedy that has both big laughs and incredible heart.

While we have a great play, we need financial ($$) help marketing it in Edinburgh so we can fill seats.

Launching a show at the Edinburgh Fringe is phase one for  Brotha Holmes. In addition to touring, we're going to shoot a pilot for a series, but none of that can happen unless we get a great start. 

Your lovely contributions will help make people think, laugh and feel a little bit better about this crazy world in which we currently live.

Update: 

 
 

The Edinburgh Fringe Festival is the world's largest arts festival, with the 2014 event spanning 25 days and featuring over 3,193 shows from 51 countries in 299 venues. Established in 1947 as an alternative to the Edinburgh International Festival, it takes place annually in Scotland's capital, in the month of August. The Fringe is a showcase for the performing arts, with show categories including Cabaret, Children's shows, Comedy, Dance, Physical Theatre & Circus, Events, Exhibitions, Music, Musicals and Opera, Spoken Word and Theatre. 

 

                                  

 

The Fringe has been host to some of the top names in the entertainment industry, and this year, our names will join them.

 

 

The campaign needs are very specific and the budget reflects the actual cost. If we do not reach our goal the money will still be divided up based on the % allocated. Here’s what your support would do for us.

 

 

Why Edinburgh? 

There is no better way to gain World-Wide exposure than at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, and the exposure we get there will enable us to accomplish our overall goals of bringing Brotha Holmes back to one of the many amazing theatres in Los Angeles,  and eventually on to New York City, and Paris. The Brotha Holmes Play is also a launch pad to the film we'll be shooting, in part, while in Edinburgh at the Fringe. Your support combined with our hard work can make all of this a reality.

 

The Perks:

As a thank you to all of our supporters, every level of support comes with a great perk. We have Signed photos, Personalized messages, Original Art, Music, Tee shirts, Private shows, Coffee with the writer/star, Associate Producer credits and many many more. At the highest levels of support, we're offering exclusive events and even 7.5% ownership of the show in perpetuity.

 

Other Ways You Can Help.. .

There are many ways to support Brotha Holmes! aside from our perk program, We would be eternally grateful if you took the time to share the link to this Indigogo page, and/or follow us on Twitter.. Facebook.

Here's the link to our venue page: Spotlites

Thank you for your support!

story:
WHAT?

Dendrolagus is a comics anthology focusing on narrative and experimentation. This 80 page first issue features a dreamy post apocalyptic botanical journey, a surreal dream house showing, different ways to deal with experiences from a demonstration, and more. Mixing the familiar with the unknown, the unreal and the too real, Dendrolagus wants to create something new in the in-between. Everyday surrealism and serious absurdity. It is based in Malmö, Sweden featuring Sweden based artists but produced in English.

WHY?

Dendrolagus loves these types of comics, and if your taking the time to read this you probably do too. They're not very market friendly tho, which is why an anthology like this is needed, and why crowdfunding is perfect for it. There's no one publishing my favourite comics and so coming from a culture of DIY I decided to start doing it myself. Someone's got to. Both for the artists' sake and the readers. There needs to exist an anthology like this.

WHO?

Editor and publisher of Dendrolagus is me, Steve Nyberg, a Swedish comic artist most known for Trygga lilla Sverige ("Safe little Sweden", Galago 2016), a collection of comics based on actual terrorist acts and horrible mass murders thru 20th century Sweden where I followed the perpetrators' every day life up until their gruesome deeds. I've also made lots of zines and love going to zine fests where you find all the great comics that flies under the radar of the mainstream. In the first issue of Dendrolagus I've gathered some of my favourite comics artists and thru an open call also found some really exciting new talent:

Amalie Götz
Jonatan Rosén
Ylva Oknelid
Hanna Lundin Tistelö
Emma-Lisa Henriksson
Rakel Stammer

HOW?

Your donations will cover the expenses of printing and paying the artists. The anthology is already half way on it's way to the printer's and will be released by the end of May. Your financial backing would give us a stable ground to continue from, minimising the financial risk and improving the possibilities for publishing more issues in the future. So if we raise even more than the set goal, we can raise the artists' pay and start producing more issues sooner.

And in exchange you can get pins, screen prints, or just a great big thanks!

(I made more versions of pins than first promised when setting up the perks so just write a comment about which one you want when putting down your pledge (Dendrolagus closeup / Treetops / Dendrolagus full body), or I'll get back to you about that.)

HELP!

Like I said, publishing comics outside the mainstream is not something you do to get rich. But we're doing it to promote interesting comics art. I hope you're interested in that too. Any help is much appreciated. If you've got limited assets but want to help Dendrolagus get made, there are other ways to do that. For example by telling your friends. Or, with the help of your social networks you can tell your acquaintances and the whole world by sharing this campaign and increase the chances of someone with money to spend finding out about it.

Thank you for your time.

 

Find out more at Dendrolagus' webpage / Facebook / Instagram

story:
Hi Guys, my name is Zack and im a comic book writer/creator form Perth, Western Australia

This is my first venture into comic book creation by my self and i would like you to not only help me with me goal but also be apart of something great.

SIN is a book the crosses genre like crazy and that will take you on a adventure like no other book coming out. It is centered around seth who is a yound adult who is coming to terms and finding out  what man he wants to be, but he has obsticules in his wy like he has powers and he hunts down monsters with his uncle and his best friend. So as you follow the story you find out the origins of his powers and how his  is going to use them and if he can get the girls of his dream the very sexy Brodie Jones.

Dear Friends, Compatriots Help me arise this Project up!

I am Andy Josean (aka Dr.Genuks) I am an Artist, worked in famous Project 'Food Chain' and others that yieded a bounch of positive opinions worldwide,

http://indyplanet.com/store/product_info.php?pr...

 Illustrator and Designer I am representing Poland into this Project, let me spread a short Polish preface within.

Szanowni Panstwo,

Obecnie wystartował wspólny Australijski oraz Polski Projekt z wytworzenia Comic Booka 'Sin the origin' ('Grzech, pochodzenie'), wiec zapoznać się ze szczególami moźna wlasnie tutaj,

Myślimy źe projekt moźe nabyć znaczenia dla społeczności Polskiej, dla tego źe Arstysta mieszka w okolice Warszawy, oraz istnieje tez moźliwość stworzenia wersji w języke Polskim w razie sukcesu w akcji zbierania srodków.

Prosze Państwa zapoznać się z Projektem równieź złoźyć swoje opinie i oraz nadać pomocy!

We need your help to raise $3000 and more :)

This money will be used for get the first issue fully drawn which mean penciled, inked, colored and letered. As well as paying to get some promotional artwork and it will help get the word out about this great book.If you donate no matter how big or how little you are guranted a free copy of the first issue as well as some other perth depending on how much you donate. like if if you donate fifty bucks you get a one of a kind signed print specially drawn for this campaign. Or if you donate one hundred and fity dollars you get your likeness used in the first issue and for the grand prize for seven hundred and fifty dollars you will be in the sin comic book series.

All of our Kind Donators, Friends and Supporters will be scribed down to Arc Angels Sanctuary forever to their will to stand against the evil for our Good!

Get Indie, Let us make something great happen!!!

Have you wanted to be apart of something great like to be there when Batman was created or to be an extra in jaws so you could say yeah i saw or i was there, well maybe with abit of luck and if you help us today could be that day. So please help me with my project!!!

Hi Guys, my name is Zack and im a comic book writer/creator form Perth, Western Australia
This is my first venture into comic book creation by my self and i would like you to not only help me with me goal but also be apart of something great.
SIN is a book the crosses genre like crazy and that will take you on a adventure like no other book coming out. It is centered around seth who is a yound adult who is coming to terms and finding out  what man he wants to be, but he has obsticules in his wy like he has powers and he hunts down monsters with his uncle and his best friend. So as you follow the story you find out the origins of his powers and how his  is going to use them and if he can get the girls of his dream the very sexy Brodie Jones.
Dear Friends, Compatriots Help me arise this Project up!
I am Andy Josean (aka Dr.Genuks) I am an Artist, worked in famous Project 'Food Chain' and others that yieded a bounch of positive opinions worldwide,
http://indyplanet.com/store/product_info.php?pr...

Szanowni Panstwo,
Obecnie wystartował wspólny Australijski oraz Polski Projekt z wytworzenia Comic Booka 'Sin the origin' ('Grzech, pochodzenie'), wiec zapoznać się ze szczególami moźna wlasnie tutaj,
Myślimy źe projekt moźe nabyć znaczenia dla społeczności Polskiej, dla tego źe Arstysta mieszka w okolice Warszawy, oraz istnieje tez moźliwość stworzenia wersji w języke Polskim w razie sukcesu w akcji zbierania srodków.
Prosze Państwa zapoznać się z Projektem równieź złoźyć swoje opinie i oraz nadać pomocy!
We need your help to raise $3000 and more :)
This money will be used for get the first issue fully drawn which mean penciled, inked, colored and letered. As well as paying to get some promotional artwork and it will help get the word out about this great book.If you donate no matter how big or how little you are guranted a free copy of the first issue as well as some other perth depending on how much you donate. like if if you donate fifty bucks you get a one of a kind signed print specially drawn for this campaign. Or if you donate one hundred and fity dollars you get your likeness used in the first issue and for the grand prize for seven hundred and fifty dollars you will be in the sin comic book series.
All of our Kind Donators, Friends and Supporters will be scribed down to Arc Angels Sanctuary forever to their will to stand against the evil for our Good!

story:
So what's going on?

Newshounds is my baby, and it's leaving the nest.

 

For the less sentimental, it's a comic that I've poured twenty years of love on, fifteen of which the world has witnessed as a webcomic at www.newshounds.com.  And now it's coming to an end.  This project determines whether it comes to a screeching halt unfinished or whether it glides to a smooth, perfect landing the way I'd intended.

 

Why am I doing this?  The outside world is starting to cave in a little.  Family issues are becoming more pressing to the point where I have very little free time anymore to finish this project.  Being a caregiver can be very stressful.  On top of it all, I'm having to balance two separate jobs in order to pay the rent.

 

Why do you need this?

 

In two months I move down to the San Francisco Bay Area to take a potentially exciting new job that's very, very part time... at least for a while.  This gives me a brief window of time where I can either temp to make up the shortfall, or I can achieve my final dream of finishing a 20-year -long work of art in a way that accomplishes my creative and philosophical goals.  Newshounds fans everywhere would be happy, and I would be happy.

 

So the amount I'm asking for allows me the time to get over the hump and get this book completed.  The final chapter of an extensive saga, rich with action and character development.  To see it in progress, visit the Newshounds website linked to above. 

 

So what do I get if I contribute?

 

I have five tiers of donations, each of which has a commission level attached... full comic pages all the way down to pencil sketches.  Plus, in 2014, you will get a rebate of 1/3 your contribution.  After the book is completed, I'm going to spend all of the last third of 2013 and all of 2014 finishing commissions in the order they were received.  I've done commissions before and you can see them at http://www.furaffinity.net/user/tkdye.  If you're not into commissions, write me and let's talk. I'm sure I can do something cool for you in return.

 

 

I don't have any money, but I'd like to help!

 

Thank you!  And you can!  It's very simple; if you have a Facebook or Twitter account, spread the word!  Anyone who posts on either form of social media will get a FREE quickie pencil sketch -- immediately!

 

Plus, there are all these Indiegogo share tools that you can use.  This place is awesome, so I encourage using it!

 

This is something that's very important to me and to the people who have followed Newshounds from day one.  It's the difference between the comic just stopping with a notice saying "I apologize, this is the end because real life has taken over," or ending with the big finish it was intended to end with.

 

Thanks to everyone who can help!  You're going to make a big difference.

story:
Who am I and What is My Comic?

Everybody has something that they’re passionate about. Me? I love the art of comics. My name’s Michael Watson, and I’ve always known I wanted to draw comic books. After being turned away from my dream company, because my drawings were too “urban” for their liking, I decided to make my own story, where my style fit perfectly.

Ideas brewed and plans were formed starting in 1999, and the first issue of Hotshot was born in 2009. I wanted it to have aspects of everything I admired in my favorite comic books; mixed with the world I created myself. In that world, I wanted to showcase characters that looked like actual people; all shapes, sizes and colors. When you read Hotshot, or any other Freestyle Komics works, you’ll realize these are characters you will find yourself relating to and believing in, because they look like you and me.

Because I’m self-employed, I need your help. This campaign will help me print as many copies as I can and spread them around Ohio and the rest of the United States. I feel that kids, and other comic book fans, should see a variety in their hero. Not just the standard superman, but someone different. From the way they look, how they talk and how they handle real life situations; not one that is limited to the extravagant “save the world” scenarios. My passion has been to show kids that you don’t have to be 6 feet tall with chiseled abs to save the day. Anybody, any color, any shape, any size, boy or girl, can be a hero. This campaign will help enormously, and is something I’m relying on to get my book out there.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $4000, to keep this book running. The money donated will be put towards a colorist and inker, but a large sum will be contributed to printing, advertising, and promoting our book to spread it around the country.

Now, wanna know what YOU get for helping us?

  • $15 dollars You get the satisfaction of knowing you helped to make a awesome, comic book happen. Your name added as one of the fallen heroes on the “Great Zero Event” Memorial Wall with in the Hotshot Universe. Get issue 6 sent to you via pdf format with your name added to the “thank you” page.
  • $20- “I am…” armband Series. 5 x 7 print of main Characters from Hotshot.
  • $25- Dre Fire Poster Signed, I Am Dre Fire Arm Band.
  • $35- JFAB Poster Signed, I am JFAB Arm Band, Jayonna Fabro Sexy Model Poster Signed.
  • $40- Hotshot Poster Signed by Art/creator/Writer, I am Hotshot Arm Band,
  • Hotshot #6 with Exclusive Cover. 
  • $50- Button set created by Mutant Cactus, Hotshot Tee Shirt, CD of Music from Hotshot. PDF of issues 0-6.
  • $60- All 7 issues of a Hotshot “A Heroes Welcome” story Arc Printed.
  • $75- All 7 issues of a Hotshot “A Heroes Welcome” story Arc Printed.
  • Signed by Artist Creator. I am Hotshot Arm Band, Music of Hotshot.
  • $90-Columbus, Ohio Fans only (unless you wanna drive here) A huge photo shoot bundle. Wanna be a glamorous star, perhaps a badass villain, or its just time for some family pictures. 2-hour photo shoot, 200 pics on CD, 30 printed in different sizes. 3 Photo shopped images.
  • $100- All 7 issues of a Hotshot “A Heroes Welcome” story Arc Printed
  • Signed by Artist Creator. I am Hotshot Arm Band, Music of Hotshot, Hotshot 18 x 24 Poster, Hotshot rare Tee Shirt. 
  • $175- Do you own a business, Get a business card design and receive 1000 copies full color front and back gloss.
  • $200- Get a logo Designed for yourself or your company. 
  • $400- Get a logo Designed, Business Cards(1000), Flyer(post card size full color front/back) Designed for your company (1000 printed) and Ad space of Hotshot issue 7.
  • $500- Get yourself Turned into reappearing Comic Character within the Freestyle Komics Universe. We will help you design him/her into the hero/villain you see yourself becoming. All 7 issues of Hotshot Signed by artist creator printed and PDF format, Music of Hotshot, Mutant Cactus Button Set, Hotshot 18 x 24 Poster of Issue 7 cover, Hotshot rare Tee Shirt.

 

The Impact

         I want my comic book to be used for more than just an enjoyable read. I want young people and comic book fans all around to be inspired, because anybody can be a hero. We want to get that word out, and also show people not to give up when your original plans may not work out. Every individual is powerful and special; nobody can change that.

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

            Not payday? Don’t exactly have change to spare right now? That’s alright! You can help us spread our campaign on Youtube, and other places from the indiegogo.com sharing tool! Remember to check us out on our pages and keep spreading our name!

Facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Freestyle-Komics/58223037337?fref=ts

Website:

http://www.fskomics.com/

story:
POP Remedy is creating & distributing comic strips to help remedy PEOPLE & PLANET.

We will do GOOD.

We can do BETTER.

Imagine a place where current syndicated comic artists, retired comic artists, and new and upcoming comic artists could create and fuel great projects that help people and planet causes...all for GOOD...always? A comic strip syndicate to remedy the world...This is POP REMEDY.

POP Remedy Syndicate: POP Remedy is a comic strip syndicate created by me, Jarrett Osborne, Husband, Father, Teacher, Artist & Entrepreneur, meant to take the successful model of a traditional print syndicate and distribute comic strips to various platforms of readership. The difference is, POP Remedy Syndicate will GIVE BACK the vast amount of its profits from memberships, comic strip collections, and merchandise to people and planet charities and causes while becoming another source of information and education. POP Remedy is a Comic Strip Syndicate to Remedy the World.


 Funding Goal


The 1st Cause: 

Spreading awareness and education and be a strong contributor and fundraiser for Kidney Disease. My son, Harrison, was born with Polycystic Kidney Disease on March 8th, 2012...ironically that was World Kidney Day.

For years, before the birth of my son, I had been struggling with 'doing good'. After channeling the advice of Joni Avram from Cause & Effect Marketing and W. Brett Wilson, Canada's leading businessmen, entrepreneurs, and philanthropists, mentor and distant 'friend'...I answered this question:

"How can I use my knowledge, my network and my personal passion to creatively meet the world's greatest needs?"

That answer was POP Remedy and a COMIC STRIP to help spread awareness and education and be a strong contributor and fundraiser for Kidney Disease. I will be championing and supporting the efforts of The Kidney Foundation of Canada, The Kidney March, and World Kidney Day, through my comic strip and GIVING BACK the vast amount of profits from memberships, comic strip collections, and merchandise. This is my cause. This is what my comic strip will Remedy.


GOOD NEWS...POP Remedy DOES NOT exist just for me and my cause. There are other artists, with other causes looking to DO GOOD. We know you are out there - we are here - waiting

The 1st Comic Strip: The first comic strip appearing under POP Remedy Syndicate is MY comic strip, 'The Pursuit of Mandy'

'The Pursuit of Mandy' is about a little girl, Mandy, and her three imagined friends, Parry, Sam and Fenton. Together and totally unbound, they experience the extraordinary wonder of childhood to its fullest, escaping the clutches of time and remind us, panel-by-panel, that it's never too late to go back. “Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them.” ― Dr. Seuss

"Touching and tender, crazy and delightful, sweet, silly, poignant, and sad. I think you captured that childhood imaginative streak beautifully... you're in a class with Bill Watterson and the top strips of Jef Mallett." - FAN

How will the Syndicate &

Comics Generate Money?:

The syndicate and comic strips will generate revenue for selected causes through Donation buttons, Web advertising, Selling original art, limited edition prints, Merchandising, book collections, Getting into print and other cause/supporting websites, comic strip and syndicate personal and corporate subscriptions, cause related marketing, comic conventions and cause campaigns which will all be attainable with partnership and support of an already established national foundation and cause like the Kidney Foundation of Canada. They alone have a social network of 10's of 1000's of people with extraordinary website visits, unique visitors and page views. Laughter is not only an easy sell...it's needed.

POP Remedy Yr 1 Marketing Plan: 

We will grow our readership by multiple online means. Specifically, we will target the members and supporters of a comic strip's charity or foundation of choice with a strong, targeted marketing initiative across social networking websites.  We will target comic strip fans directly (of course!), and target new demographics outside comic and charity specific profile tags across ALL social networking websites.

Our marketing will prove successful after developing a new loyal fan base for the comic strip as well as educating and finding new supporters for charity/cause the comic represents.


POP Remedy Target Audiences:

First and foremost, our comics will target those that love comics and love to laugh. PERIOD. Our comics are not controlled by any industry, business or charity and are not themed after any charity/organization it may support. The comics and creators featured and distributed by POP Remedy Syndicate are simply passionate about people and planet, about charity and cause and philanthropy, and have decided to subscribe to a new syndicate model.

POP Remedy Launch Date: Our Syndicate and 1st comic will launch on World Kidney Day, March 13th, 2014. Approximately 8 months later we will have our first comic strip collection ready for print and purchase for the holiday season. 

POP REMEDY IS FOR EVERYBODY.

Total Funding Goal: $10,000

Tipping Point Funds will cover 3 needs essential to the development of the syndicate and inaugural comic strip which will lead to the content of our first POP Remedy published Comic Strip Compilation. The 1st is artist supplies for a full year of production. With experience, outside expertise and quotes from various worldwide suppliers. The 2nd is an updated computer system, hardware and software capable of bringing the syndicate and comic to life. The good people at apple store have put together a competitive business package that will meet my needs. The 3rd is professional website development for both the syndicate and comic strip. I have comparable quotes from established and reputable website designers. 

Beyond Funding Goal

If POP Remedy raises funds beyond the goal of $10,000, every penny extra will go towards simple target marketing the printing of the first comic strip collection. Having funds up front allows us to secure the books and sell and rather than rely on pre-sales. Our goal is to print and sell 10,000 copies of our first comic strip collection.

This will help raise thousands and thousands of dolllars for The Kidney Foundation of Canada, The Kidney March and World Kidney Day and ignite a revolution for good and set the stage for new comics and causes.

Amazing Perks!

From published recognition, to signed POP Remedy Collections, original signed strips and comic collections from some of comics best talents, and even 3 signed Garfield Collections from the great and influential Jim Davis...we have a PERK for every SUPPORTER!

Thank you for your support!

Having funds up front allows us to secure the books and sell and rather than rely on pre-sales. Our goal is to print and sell 10,000 copies of our first comic strip collection.
This will help raise thousands and thousands of dolllars for The Kidney Foundation of Canada, The Kidney March and World Kidney Day and ignite a revolution for good and set the stage for new comics and causes.

Amazing Perks!
From published recognition, to signed POP Remedy Collections, original signed strips and comic collections from some of comics best talents, and even 3 signed Garfield Collections from the great and influential Jim Davis...we have a PERK for every SUPPORTER!



Thank you for your support!

story:
What We Need & What You Get

Short and sweet. The first issue (of five) of our comic is finished thanks to the support of all of you kick ass fans. But now we need the funds to print up a limited number of issues so you can all get your hands on it.

Help us out and be the first to read the beginning of Charge's epic journey that takes place before the events of the movies "All Superheroes Must Die" and "The Last Superhero"!

Any cash we raise over the printing/shipping fee will immediately go towards the production of Issue #2! 


To whomever finds this comic,

In 2010, when I was 23 years old, I made a film called, “All Superheroes Must Die” with a handful of friends and a paper-thin budget. Though we didn’t have money, we had love for the genre and wanted to create our own world of Superheroes to share with the world. 

Like the movie, we don’t have millions of dollars. But this comic is for fans, made by fans. After the ongoing battle of money versus quality we waged with comic publishers, we decided to fund and release this comic ourselves so you can all see our true vision, untouched by the executives of the world who hold calculators in their hands instead of comics.

Love it or hate it, this is the comic we wanted to make and share with you. To all of you who have helped support our wild ride onto the shelves, we can never thank you enough. If nothing else, this comic’s release proves one thing. If you put everything into your dreams you can achieve anything.  Impossible is just something quitters say to feel better about themselves.

Thank you all.

Enjoy,

Jason Trost

story:
Ciao, I’m George Cochrane, and welcome to my Indiegogo! 

After the wildly successful Kickstarter campaign, I now present you the entire Divine Comedy in a fresh and captivating graphic-novel style!  

  • A Symbol of Italian Culture, History and Language 
  • An Heirloom to Share with Your Children, Grandchildren, and Loved Ones 
  • A Divine Comedy Like You've Never Seen Before, in a Fine Press Edition

 

 

2021 is a Special Year – the 700th Anniversary of Dante Alighieri’s Death

 

I bring you the first fully hand-written, hand-illustrated version of the Divine Comedy since the 15th century. Join me in celebrating the Year of Dante with my Indiegogo campaign to publish La Divina Commedia - The New Manuscript. 

Designed and Printed in Italy, my Fine Press, Limited Edition Divine Comedy will be Produced in Five Different Editions 

A rare gift for collectors, scholars and enthusiasts, and an heirloom to pass on to future generations.

 

 

I first “met” Dante in Italy as a college student in the 90’s - and although I sensed the poem’s greatness, my first copy of the Divine Comedy seemed impossible to understand. I soon made it my life’s work to create a new Divine Comedy that a younger me would understand!

 

 

For decades, even before beginning work on my manuscript, I carefully studied and researched the Divine Comedy by: 

  •  Learning Italian in order to understand the original text
  •  Analyzing the past 700 years of art inspired by the Divine Comedy 
  •  Mastering my own original hand writing and graphic style. 

And then, like a medieval monk, I spent every day for the past seven years writing and illustrating the manuscript by hand.

 

 

Making The Divine Comedy More Accessible 

Dante's poetry is beautiful, but the truth is that the implications and the richness of his references are incredibly complex. The Divine Comedy is more widely known than read. I wanted to create a more engaging version for generations to come.

 

 

 

 

La Divina Commedia – The New Manuscript includes: 

 

  • 384 Fully Illustrated Pages – 12” x 10” (30 x 25 cm.) 
  • 7 Years of Work culminates in one of the most beautiful versions of the Divine Comedy ever created
  • Gorgeous Book Design Made and Printed in Italy, with Premium Materials

 

Choose your Edition: each is a unique gift for collectors, scholars and enthusiasts, and as an heirloom to pass on to future generations.

Each version comes in a decorated slipcase or deluxe protective case.

ANNIVERSARY EDITION | $ 179

 

  • 15 two-page spreads + Maps of the Afterlife: 33 Pages in Full Color 
  •  Red Hardcover Coffee Table Book with Custom Dante Overlay Design
  •  Soft Slipcase 
  •  3 Silk Book Markers – Black/Hell, Red/Purgatory, White/Heaven
  •  Your Name Printed on the Backers List

​

COLLECTOR EDITION | $ 289

Limited edition available in Italian or English. Gorgeous Bodoni binding on Italian paper, printed on unique next-gen press for deluxe finishing.

Individually signed by artist George Cochrane, book designer Giulia Fogliani, and publisher Giovanni Scorcioni.

 

 

  • 15 two-page spreads + Maps of the Afterlife: 33 Pages in Full Color 
  • Bodoni Binding with Elegant Black Edges 
  • Custom Dante Overlay Design w/ Golden Details (Front/Back/Spine) 
  • 3 Silk Book Markers: Black/Hell, Bronze/Purgatory, Gold/Heaven
  • Black & Gold Hard Slipcase
  •  Your Name Printed on the Backers List

 

HERITAGE EDITION | $ 489 (English version is Sold Out)

Only 30 copies available, ITALIAN Edition: Get it NOW or NEVER!

Limited edition bound in premium binding material: Fedrigoni ECF natural black paper, and Skivertex© by Italian maker Fontana Grafica in Milan.

Each copy can be personalized with a text chosen by the backer, printed in golden letters on the back cover of the book.

Individually signed by artist George Cochrane, book designer Giulia Fogliani, and publisher Giovanni Scorcioni.

 

 

  • 30 two-page spreads + Maps of the Afterlife: 63 Pages in Full Color 
  • Personalized with your Dedication Text on Back Cover in Gold Letters
  • Premium Material: Skivertex by Fontana Grafica (Spine/Slipcase)
  • Bodoni Binding with Elegant Black Edges 
  • 3 Silk Book Markers: Black/Hell, Bronze/Purgatory, Gold/Heaven
  • Black & Gold Hard Slipcase
  • Your Name Printed on the Backers List

​

GOLD EDITION | $ 2,600

Limited edition (15 copies in Italian; 15 copies in English)

Hand-bound in elegant Bodoni binding. Spine is in genuine black-tanned leather by Conceria 800 (Livorno, Italy). Boards in black-stained ash wood. Hand-made design with 24 Karat Gold Leaf. Elegant gilt edges, with hand-sewn double color headbands.

Presented in a deluxe rotating case, that is perfect to display your prized Divine Comedy at home.

Individually signed and dedicated by artist George Cochrane, book designer Giulia Fogliani, and publisher Giovanni Scorcioni.

 

 

  • 30 two-page spreads + Maps of the Afterlife: 63 Pages in Full Color 
  • Custom Dante Overlay Design in Genuine 24 Karat Gold Leaf (Front/Back)
  • Hand-Bound with Solid Wood Boards and Black-Tanned Leather
  • Bodoni Binding with Elegant Gilt Edges 
  • Deluxe Rotating Acrylic Display
  • Your Name Printed on the Backers List
  • Signed by artist George Cochrane
 
 

EMPYREAN EDITION | $ 18,000

Based on the Gold Edition, and Individually Hand-Colored by the Artist

 

The most lavish edition is strictly limited to 1 copy in Italian, and 1 copy in English.

To hand-color the pages George Cochrane will use his magnificent ancient pigments that include genuine 24 Karat gold, lapis lazuli, and the renowned verdaccio. All pigments are from Zecchi Colori, historical art supplier in Florence.

 

Hand-colored by the artist:

  • 100 two-page spreads (200 pages) 
  • The final page of each of the three canticle (6 pages) 
  • YOU, the backer, will select three two-page spreads (6 pages)

The artist will hand-color the opening of each of the 100 cantos plus the end of each canticle (Hell, Purgatory and Heaven).

 

In addition to this, YOU, the backer, will pick THREE two-page spreads, and George Cochrane will hand color them in your copy. 

 

INFERNO PORTFOLIO | $ 129

Five Drawings from Hell

Preserved in an elegant cloth-covered portolio (14 x 20"; 36 x 51 cm.) this selection of devilish artworks by George Cochrane emerge from Dante's Hell. With a certificate of authentication signed by the artist.

This portfolio is a beautiful and valuable set, a perfect gift, or ideal to be framed for your home.

 

 

This portfolio of illustrations captures a variety of scenes from Dante's Inferno, and includes a portrait of Dante in Florence.

  • “I demoni del canto XXI”: Artist-made watercolor from pure, ancient pigments
  • “Il puzzo del canto XI”: Lead and tin point on artist-prepared paper with pure pigment (Blu di cobalto medio/Cobalt blue medium)
  • “Ritratto di Dante”: Silverpoint on artist-prepared paper with ancient pure pigment (Ocra calda d’Italia/Italian warm ochre)
  • “La selva selvaggia”: Noce di galla - artist-made/ground watercolor from pure sanguine pigment using an ancient recipe
  • “Porta dell'Inferno”: Artist-made/ground watercolor from pure sanguine pigment.

Shipping Cost

Shipping cost will be calculated after the campaign ends, so to charge you with the lowest available rate. The more copies we sell and ship, the better our shipping rate will be. 

We cap our shipping cost to $35 for the USA; $29 for European countries; $19 for Italy. We will quote other destinations individually.

Over time, as I studied the centuries of illuminated manuscripts of the Divine Comedy, I recognized the connection between them and comic art. Just like early editions of the poem, a comic tells an easy-to-read story using words and pictures in sequential order. 

 

Medieval Manuscripts as a Source of Inspirations 

The marriage of words and pictures to tell a story is powerful. I thought that if I used comic art techniques, I could create a more accessible and engaging version of the Divine Comedy that would change the way modern and future generations read the poem, and maybe, just maybe, the Divine Comedy would become more widely read than ever before.

 

 

On the Shoulders of Giants 

I tried to understand seven centuries of art inspired by Dante’s work. I had to became familiar with not only Michelangelo, Botticelli, Gustave Doré, Joseph Koch, William Blake, but also Manfredo Manfredini, Ebba Holm, and Antonio Zatta. Studying illustrations alone was not enough: I desperately needed to see the exquisite medieval manuscripts Dante was familiar with, and to observe the relationship between the images and the text.

 

In Search of The Perfect Text 

Once I saw the differences among Italian versions of Dante’s text, I began a research that took me back in time.

To underscore the philological uncertainty of the Commedia, I decided to transcribe three different sources:

  • Inferno — Giorgio Petrocchi (1967): the most widely disseminated and generally accepted version of Dante's text. 
  • Purgatorio — Codice Landiano (1336): one of the oldest datable manuscripts of the Divine Comedy that has never been transcribed before. 
  • Paradiso — Codice Trivulziano 1080 (1337): largely considered one of the most “accurate” and finest of the early manuscripts of the Commedia.

 

 

 

The Commedia and Comics

 

American comic book writers had a huge influence on my work. Wallace Wood’s 22 Panels That Always Work became something I looked to frequently; for instance, having just a sliver of the face visible (profil perdu) at the edge of the page brings the reader closer to the scene.

 

 

 

Beyond the Italian Reader 

George’s ambition is to spread his Divine Comedy all over the world using all the available translations. But his time on this planet is limited.

To reproduce Cochrane’s artwork in every language without losing the beauty of the handwritten text, we commissioned a typeface designer to create a digital font based on George’s lettering art.

We chose a contextual alternates font: each letter exists in 4-5 different forms that are randomly used in the text, so as to mimic real handwriting in the best possible way.

 

Why Charles Singleton's Translation? 

The difficulty of translating Dante’s Divine Comedy has dogged scholars for centuries.

As George’s understanding deepened, he embraced Charles Singleton’s version as the finest. Singleton sidestepped the hurdle of Dante’s interlocking rhyme scheme by offering his translation in prose, and thereby freeing him to aspire to superior linguistic accuracy. His profound knowledge of Dante, resulting from years of his own cutting-edge research, informed his every word choice.

His commentaries, published separately, explained his translation decisions and explicated areas of ongoing textural disagreement.

 

 

 

George Cochrane is an Artist and Professor of Fine Art at Fairleigh Dickinson University in Florham Park, New Jersey.  Cochrane’s foundational Italian experiences, including becoming fluent in the language, occurred during his junior year abroad. They began in Venice, as an intern at the Peggy Guggenheim Collection. In Florence, his academic year included Studio Art and Italian language study through Sarah Lawrence’s resident program. He also studied Art History at the Università di Firenze.

 

Cochrane has widely exhibited his artwork, including the Massachusetts Museum of Contemporary Art (Mass MoCA) in North Adams, and the Castello dei Conti Guidi, in Poppi, Italy. 

 

Columbia University invited Cochrane to publish his commentary on sixteen selected pages on their website “Digital Dante” (https://digitaldante.columbia.edu/image/cochrane-illustrations/).

The author has lectured and exhibited his Dante work in Italy and the U.S., and has upcoming events throughout the year.

The Museo Archeologico Nazionale dell’Umbria in Perugia will showcase Cochrane’s work in spring 2021.

 

 

 

What better way to reimagine Dante's work than to publish it with the help of businesses based in the same territory that Dante knew so well?

 

 

Facsimile Finder is a bookseller and publisher specializing in high-quality replicas of illuminated manuscripts. For the past 12 years, Facsimile Finder has been providing the world's leading universities and private collectors with first-rate reproductions of historical manuscripts.

  •  Clara Semprini, project manager
  •  Kiana Jones, editor and copywriter, press office manager
  •  Vanessa Para, photographer and videographer
  •  Sabrina Rossi, accounting and logistics
  •  Giacomo Cecchetti, publishing consultant
  •  Bottega dei Gozzi, artisanal bookbindery
  •  Alessio D'Ellena, typeface designer

Many thanks to Roberto Bini (Il Bulino) for borrowing the design of the deluxe acrylic case.

Risks & Challenges

As every other project in the world, from making pancakes to building a space rocket, there are small and big challenges that we expect to solve during the production process. The good news is the entire artistic work is finished, and that was true even before we started our Indiegogo campaign! Our long experience in the publishing business gives us plenty of alternatives in terms of suppliers and technical solution, so everything we expect to be challenging will be solved by our hands-on approach. George Cochrane, the artist, lives in New York City, while the publishing team, printing company, and the binding workshop are all based in Italy. The distance might have represented a risk but now that all the art is finished and already shipped to Italy the risk is negligible. We're keeping it safe and ready to become the most beautiful Divine Comedy you've ever seen!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us in getting the word out and make some noise about your campaign,
  • Remind to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

 

This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.

The Museo Archeologico Nazionale dell’Umbria in Perugia will showcase Cochrane’s work in spring 2021.
 

 

 
What better way to reimagine Dante's work than to publish it with the help of businesses based in the same territory that Dante knew so well?
 

 
Facsimile Finder is a bookseller and publisher specializing in high-quality replicas of illuminated manuscripts. For the past 12 years, Facsimile Finder has been providing the world's leading universities and private collectors with first-rate reproductions of historical manuscripts.


 Clara Semprini, project manager
 Kiana Jones, editor and copywriter, press office manager
 Vanessa Para, photographer and videographer
 Sabrina Rossi, accounting and logistics
 Giacomo Cecchetti, publishing consultant
 Bottega dei Gozzi, artisanal bookbindery
 Alessio D'Ellena, typeface designer

Many thanks to Roberto Bini (Il Bulino) for borrowing the design of the deluxe acrylic case.

Risks & Challenges
As every other project in the world, from making pancakes to building a space rocket, there are small and big challenges that we expect to solve during the production process. The good news is the entire artistic work is finished, and that was true even before we started our Indiegogo campaign! Our long experience in the publishing business gives us plenty of alternatives in terms of suppliers and technical solution, so everything we expect to be challenging will be solved by our hands-on approach. George Cochrane, the artist, lives in New York City, while the publishing team, printing company, and the binding workshop are all based in Italy. The distance might have represented a risk but now that all the art is finished and already shipped to Italy the risk is negligible. We're keeping it safe and ready to become the most beautiful Divine Comedy you've ever seen!

Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

Help us in getting the word out and make some noise about your campaign,
Remind to use the Indiegogo share tools!


 

 
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.

story:
Hi my name is Leslie Jones. I have been a comic since 1987, I started when i was in college. To be honest i didnt even know i was funny until my friend entered me into college contest. But when i touched the mic i was a changed soul. My goal was to be a servant for the people and provide laughter. I LOVE IT!!! I love going up with my energy and making people happy for the short period they are there in front of me. I love the sound of laughter. And all these years doing comedy its been my main goal to become the next great comic for the world. I know i can do it cause i have been all over the world doing comedy. I hope very soon that i will have my own tv show, but its a long road ahead. 

I have been on countless comedy shows like Def Jam, Comedy Central's Premium Blend and The Ruckus, Comics Unleashed, etc.. My Tv Credits include "The Mind od Mencia, Sullivan and Sons, Girlfriends, See Dad Run. And many movies National Security, Lottery Ticket, and just finsh one with Chris Rock. I also have my own Showtime special called "Problem Child".

And its not easy, which is why i am doing this campaign. Even though i try to make sure i book as many gigs as possible, the comedy game has changed. Its not as much work out there like it use to be. I use to have at least 3 to 4 gigs a month,  Im finding now more gigs get cancelled as fast as i book them. I am so close, Been writing this new show and it is very possible it will get picked up but it takes a while and a lot of work. I want to make it to the promise land but i need a little help to make it all the way. Thats where you come in. I just need enough to make through next month. I have many meeting and rewrites all while trying to live to. I know it aint easy for everyone thats why if you contribute i will be more than thankful i will be blessed. I will make sure you never pay for a ticket to see me perform and for who ever asks i will come perform for you. All you have to do is email me request, and believe me that will the best perk you will get your life.  The funds will be use for expenses like PR, websites, and rent and gas and food.  I am so close to my dream, i just need YOU to believe in me. And even if you can't give you can spread the word, would be so appreciated.

I have spent most of my life making people laugh and right now this world needs it. Please help me make you laugh. Thanks in Advance!!!!

story:
With just a few days remaining, we are very close to our 900 stretch goal! If we reach it, everyone who donated at $10 or more will get our glorious Indiegogo variant cover!

At $1000 everyone gets a set of six LOB trading cards! We can easily hit that goal!!!! Share, and if you can, contribute!!!!

Thanks for all of your support!

 

STRETCH GOAL!!

 

FUNDED, and it feels so good! We are over 100% but still growing strong! We are proud to announce our first stretch goal! If we can get to $950 we will give all physical orders a 6 card LOB trading card set! This will feature art by David Johnson Jr nd other talented artists! WE have also added tiers to give you even ore choices!
WE also have an Exclusive Indiegogo cover that you can get that will only be available during this campaign!
 

 

 

I am Gene Hoyle, author of Gateway Runners, Junkman Billy, and other stories published in Nerd Nation Presents. I also cohost the Nerd Nation Radio podcast. Labyrinth of Bones is my first dark fantasy book. 

  • Labyrinth Of Bones was started as a short story. I just wanted to set something in the world of myth and magic. It became much more when I suffered a ruptured brain aneurysm that almost did me in. Almost a year later, I struggle to do many things that I took for granted. Add in the fact that I wasn't ready for the emotional toll that came with all of this. Through all that  I saw a bigger world in Farson. A much darker world. This book would become my comeback, my return to writing. It may be the most important thing that I ever write because it almost didn't happen.
  • David Johnson Jr, Michael Waggoneer,and Erin Musgrave, the rest of the creative team also had personal and/or medical problems of their own. It was as if we were cursed. They made sure that we stayed the course though. The book had to happen. For all of us. We all needed this to regain our own souls and to show the world that we had what it takes. We showed the same tenacity as Gil does in mastering the Labyrinth
  •  
  • All of the rewards are directly related to the book, and our goal is modest. We all have enough confidence in what we have made that we are all being paid in copies of the book. We know that it will sell at shows and in stores. We just need your help in making that happen.

 

  • our 600 dollar goal will cover printing copies of the book, Indiegogo fees, and shipping and packing of the book and other prizes.. We hope to go over our goal and use the extra for promotion and more copies of the books.

 

  • The perks are simple and to the point. We want to sell the book and not t-shirts, We do have a few amazing pieces of concept art by David Johnson Jr. that are one of a kind. 
  • We have just teamed with Fandom Finery to offer this fun and neat LOB product to our tiers

"Special limited-edition soap made by Fandom Finery especially for the Labyrinth of Bones fundraiser and premiere. The skull-and-crossbones shaped soap is herbal scented and made with moisturizing goat's milk." Other great products from FF can be found at http://fandomfinery.com/

  •  
  •  
  • The book itself is 24 pages long. Check out a 3 page preview below

 

The book is finished and ready to print. All we need are your pledges. 

  • Gateway Runners was my first campaign. Even though it was a success, I was able to learn a lot about the post campaign work and am using that knowledge to make this run even better than that one did. I want to make comic books for the rest of my life. I can only do this by being an honest guy, and by delivering on what I promise. You will be kept up to date on printing, shipment and I will even contact you to see how I did. 

Risks & Challenges

The risks on this project are minimal. The book is done. The tier prizes will be done and ready by the campaigns end and delivered to you soon after. The day the book returns from the printer I will begin shipping. 

  • Much of my time and money is spent on comic books. I know what it takes to ship them safely and securely. Your book will arrive bagged and boarded and ready to enjoy. 
  • I will be available during the process to inform you of the exact date of your books arrival. tracking numbers will be given and my personal phone number will be given to every backer. 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Pledging a tier is vital. Hitting our goal and beyond helps make this dream come true and gets the book in your hand. There are other things to do to help support what we are doing. 
  • 1. Share this campaign on your social networks. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, whatever! The biggest challenge in any Indiegogo is getting the word out to potential patrons. You can make the difference in Labyrinth Of Bones being made. 
  • 2. If you go to the comic shop every Wednesday for your new books, tell them about us. We have tiers made for retailers, and that means that more people get to read the book. 

 

An afterword....

 

 

I had a text page prepared for Labyrinth Of Bones that we did not have room for, but I want it to be seen. Here it is.

The Year Of The Bones

The general thought is that you always put something of yourself into your work. This has never been more true to me than with Labyrinth Of Bones. 
The turbulent year has been the best and worst of my life. Catastrophic health issues, emotional rollercoasters higher and lower than I have ever experienced before. triumphs and losses, and still the urge to create burned in me. 
Labyrinth was written as a five or six pager to maybe be a story in Nerd Nation Presents. It turned into so much more.
It wasnt just me on this roller coaster ride though. Misery loves company, and I had the best. 
First, the writing process went far better when my editor stepped in and made a few story suggestions. Erin Musgrave helped me really see that the kingdom of Farson was far bigger than I expected. It was also far darker. 
Erin became the Constant Reader in my life that Stephen King always spoke of. I can't begin to tell you how much she meant to the process. 
David Johnson Jr and Michael Wagoneer were also traversing rough waters, but they were also dedicated to creating. They saw something in the script that made them want to bring it to life. 
I had met the two in 2012 while working on Solestar, a charity book written by Siike Donnelly. I wanted to work with as many of that crew as I could, and continue to work towards that.
Through health issues and personal issues, they hung on and kept me going. If Erin was my compass, Dave and Mikey were the sails, catching the wind and getting us to our destination. We are truly Brothers In Arms. I owe them an unpayable debt. 
Gil Ridden is waiting for you, so I won't keep you much longer. The Labyrinth Of Bones has never been beaten. Don't worry though, Gil has a plan.

Gene Hoyle.
6-9-2017
West Palm Beach, Florida
