There are commissions, e-books,original art prints, and even a chance to have yourself (or a friend, dog, whatever!) drawn into Book 2 as a cameo! Your donation will support a pair of talented creators, independent publishing, AND get you some great swag.

 





Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word about our campaign! Retweet us, post us to your facebook, pass around our videos.Support our Shop: http://waywardstudios.storenvy.com/Fav us on G+ or Facebook:
or follow me on twitter!Check out our Ustream: http://www.livestream.com/aspectcomic?t=496052And our main website: www.waywardstudios.netAnd thanks for taking the time to look at our funding campaign! We’re excited to be publishing our first book ever in true dead-tree format!

story:
Short Summary

Salutations! My name is Lauren Fleites, and I am the Editor-in-Chief and publicist for The Legend of the Fallen, a comic series in the making! Taking place in an abandoned human settlement called Atlantis, four lone kittens find themselves orphaned and on the run. Some cats want to help them, others want to harm them. And looming on the horizon is the fulfillment of a prophecy- four cats with immense power will either bathe the land in blood, or save it.

Main Characters

Spark: Spark is a kind, generous, and polite young cat who'd make a good leader. He's willing to take the hit for those he cares about, much to the dismay and anger of his loved ones. 

Mist: Mist is a hot-headed kitten who tends to yell at others. She's tough and brutally honest, but she means well. Besides not taking no for an answer, she believes in trying as hard as possible to protect others. 

Moon: Moon is kind and caring, treasuring those she holds closest to her kitten heart. In fact, they're all she knows. If any of them were to die, a piece of her would go with them. As such, she tends to get furious if any of her loved ones take what she sees as unnecessary risks. Additionally, she experiences nightmares of those she loves disappearing, a product of her deepest fears.

Fire: Fire is simple and almost even childish, his curiousity leading him into catastrophic problems. He thinks with his belly most of the time, but he can tell when others are upset, and will try to comfort them. But underneath the innocent exterior is another personality, one that takes over his body when he uses his special ability: this personality is cold, arrogant, and unsympathetic to those around him, even when they are hurt. Sometimes, however, he'll begrudgingly stick his neck out to help a cat in need.

What We Need & What You Get

Our general goal for this project is $15,000. Our starving artists need to eat, you know! Don't worry, donators will be getting neat goodies out of their contributions, like personal thank-you notes, and even your name credited in our comics. With the money, we're hoping to have the first three of a projected ten issues completed, and even an animated trailer to bring in a bigger crowd for future fundraisers with even more rewards.

The Impact

Hosam Saeed, the creator and brains behind this project, has for three years fostered this comic like one of his own. And now, with help from myself and the artists that joined our team with no strings attached, his dream to bring his idea to the masses has a chance of becoming real. We're just a bunch of average joes, perhaps even worse off than that, but we desire to work together to bring this comic to you, our audience. And that's all we can really ask for. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get on Facebook, get on Twitter, get on Tumblr or any other blogs you can think of and please spread the word! If we can at least raise $2,000, that'll be just enough to get by on so we can create an even better fundraiser! Thank you for whatever support you can give us!

story:
">t

Ghostcat and The World of the Incredibly Strange is an 70 page black and white comic following a character called Ghostcat who has an obsession with finding ghosts, the only issue is the ghosts don't really want to be found...

The comics essentially stem from my love of the dark and surreal mixed in with even darker and surreal humour hopefully giving the comic an extra dosage of nonsensical mirth.

I do everything myself from illustration, editing and writing the comics and it is rewarding for me to see it start to all come together finally. With the help of Indiegogo and hopefully a few backers, I hope to make the final step and put my comic into print and available for everybody online and hopefully (in my wildest dreams) one day soon, in stores.

The funding goes directly towards printing, packaging and postage costs plus the Indiegogo fee + VAT.

If you have any questions don't hesitate to contact me. I ship anywhere in the world. If you live on another planet, please let me know and I'll see what I can do.

story:
What is Asian Comics Collection about?

Asian Comics Collection brings to you an amazing collection of comics from Singapore. Through Indiegogo, we would like to introduce to the world some of the wonderful comic titles from this sunny island.

There are a lot of great comic books published by small publishers and indie creators in Asia. The money raised will be used to fund an ebooks platform where we can introduce, offer previews and retail good comic books in this region to audiences all over the world.

Why should I support Asian Comics Collection?

For the love of good stories!

In supporting Asian Comics Collection, we have an exciting lineup of ebooks (pdf format) as rewards. You can read these ebooks on tablets, computers and smartphones. So let’s scroll further and see what great stuff we have line up for you.

A collection not to be missed!

We have assembled a fantastic collection of comics belonging to different genre: drama, humor, action, sci-fi and culture. We are pretty sure there is something here that you can walk away with.

Drama

Letters by Shawn Yap. Growing up is an adventure; fun; painful, and always confusing. Letters follows the journey of a young boy as he finds an unexpected anchor through the chaos of childhood, in a friend he never met except in letters. (140 pages)

 

Closets by Shawn Yap. Closets reveals a tale of joy and pain, as seen through the private lenses of childhood. Peer through the door into the oft hidden reaches of boyhood experience where not everything is as they seem on the surface. (29 pages)

 

The Unethical Tale of Tom Dacre by Shirin Rafie. Based in 19th century London, a little chimney boy by the name of Tom Dacre was minding his own business cleaning chimneys, when an unexpected black smog envelops London, turning everyone into zombies! (90 pages)

Humor

Billy and Saltie by Sinann Cheah. Sinann is a self-syndicated cartoonist from Asia. Join two good friends, Billy and Saltie - an Aboriginal boy and his good pal, a huge saltwater crocodile - in their daily adventures as they tackle issues on life, wildlife and the environment with offbeat humour and wit. (120 pages)

 

Long Overdue by Deda Daniel, an Italian based in Singapore. Nicoli has a huge problem: the pages in a precious book are disappearing one page after another. She realized the culprit is the pirate Balthasar. The book is long overdue and has incurred a huge fine. That leaves Nicoli no choice but to set on an adventure to get her book back! (Estimate 120 pages)

 

Unanswered by Stickgirl. A little book of random questions, which you may have asked at some point in your life... (72 pages)

Action

Project Red (volume 1, ongoing and ends at volume 2) by Shawn Siao and Wan. All is not what it seems in a vibrant city-state in the 22nd century. Beneath the veneer of progress and development, what exactly lies behind the facade of a modern metropolis? (170 pages)

 

Jack Doe by Shawn Yap and Gabriel Chua. Jack Doe, Central City’s greatest detective, is called out of anonymity when a close friend is killed. But what starts out to be an ordinary murder unravels to become a conspiracy that brings him closer to the answers he had been searching for. (185 pages)

 

Awaken by Ng Shi Kian. Ori leads a mundane life. But on the night of his nineteenth birthday, his world takes a sharp dive into the bizarre when he find himself thrust into the thick of an inter-realm feud, where entire worlds, including his own, are at stake! (163 pages)

 

Three is an anthology featuring the story and art of Kelvin Chan aka Rocketraygun and the animation twins: Zeng Lin and Ren Lin. The anthology compiles the first chapter of Kelvin's The Battlemonks, Zeng's The Yellow Monkeys and Ren's Requim of the Three Kingdoms. (64 pages)

 

Rocketraygun is the first sketchbook by Kelvin Chan! This paperback collects his personal sketches, coloured illustrations of character designs, fan art, and some of the comic panels he's working on. (96 pages)

 

Sci-fi

VACC (volume 1 to 3, ongoing) by JDC Amane. An alien contaminant is unwittingly freed. In order to counter the threat, Earth formulates its own special defence known as the Vaccinatorians (VACC)! (Estimated 432 pages)

 

Arena Sci-fi features five strange and intriguing short stories by various writers and artists. Revel in stories ranging from lunar honeymoons and future military death weaponry, to deluded science matter and psychic detectives. (144 pages)

 

Arena Fantasy features five weird and wonderful short stories by various writers and artists. Enjoy tales ranging from cyber exorcists and twisted ancient mythologies, to feuding mystics and demented fairytales. (144 pages)

 

Culture


Imperial scandals at its worst! Infamous Chinese Emperors contains 13 stories on China's most notorious emperors - a motley crew of squanderers, murderers, thugs, lechers and idiots swaggering under the cloak of a Son of Heaven! (194 pages)

 

Enough with the imperial scandals. Great Chinese Emperors contains 27 inspiring stories of China’s most capable rulers. These are the emperors standing tall in the annals of Chinese history as a result of their outstanding contributions and awe-inspiring character. (194 pages)

 

Genghis Khan tells the rise of Temujin, from an angst-ridden youth trying to rebuild his clan to become a fearsome warrior fighting back to regain what he had lost and more. (194 pages)

 

Journey to the West is one of the greatest treats in Chinese literature. A fantastic tale of the Buddhist monk Xuanzang as he travels west in search of Buddhist sutras with his three disciples. (178 pages)

How do the rewards work?

Each tier that you contribute entitles you to a certain amount of credits and you get to choose any titles that are listed.

In addition to the ebooks above, we are also giving away exclusive desktop, tablet and phone wallpapers!

These ebooks come with a tiny digital watermark. The digital watermark shows that you are the owner and appears at the bottom of each page of the ebook. There's no restrictions on these ebooks and you can read them on any tablets, computers and smartphones.

What's our plans with the money?

A portion of the money goes to the amazing creators and publishers who have participated in this project. There are also the costs incurred from Indiegogo, Paypal and marketing. The remaining amount we have will be used to fund the development of our ebooks platform so that we can continue to share amazing comics with you and everyone around the world.

A big thank you!

Thank you so much for checking out our Indiegogo page and we look forward to your support!
